Du som konsult får även tillgång till vårt nätverk av spännande företag och uppdragsgivare! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult trivs, känner en trygghet och gemenskap till oss som arbetsgivare. Vi erbjuder tjänstepension, löneväxling och möjlighet till flexpension. Du får även tillgång till vår förmånsportal, där du utöver friskvårdsbidrag har tillgång till mängder av rabatter och erbjudanden inom hälsa, hem och fritid, transport, sjukvård och mycket mer! Ditt välmående är av högsta prioritet för oss och vi erbjuder därför dig som anställd Företagshälsovård för att hantera vardagens alla utmaningar, både på jobbet och i privatlivet.

    Lön

    Enligt överenskommelse.

    Tillträde och ansökan

    Heltid, kontorstider. Vår kund önskar start omgående och uppdraget förväntas löpa t.o.m. 2025-04-30 med möjlighet till förlängning. Du kommer att vara anställd av JobBusters som konsult hos vår spännande kund. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan (gärna i Word-format). Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-09-20.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging status quo in the property management industry. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our rapidly growing product and engineering organization is approaching 100 highly skilled professionals.




Our cloud-based platform is unique, and in a brief time, we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player on the market. Our product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?




The role:

As an AI Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for our organization's AI-focused initiatives, unlocking the full potential of artificial intelligence to create transformative solutions for our business opportunities. With your expertise in generative AI, you and your team will lead the charge in crafting cutting-edge AI strategies and solutions. You will be pivotal in defining how we apply AI solutions to business problems. We want to deeply integrate AI across our organization, drive innovation and ensure that AI is a clear part of our business strategy.




You will be reporting to our CTO and Head of AI Product.




Who You Are:

You are an experienced and driven software engineer who has been part of the generative AI wave, and both experimented with and shipped applications to real users. Complex challenges do not deter you; they intrigue you. You tackle them methodically, finding practical solutions that truly make a difference.




You prefer working in a team with developers, designers and product managers and deeply collaborate with your team rather than working from specifications. You communicate effectively and can discuss the pros and cons of different options in constructive ways.

As the AI field is moving forward at enormous speed, you are constantly following tech news for interesting developments that you can use to solve business problems.




Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineers, and product managers, to define requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in generative AI, actively following open-source projects and explore innovative AI technologies that can benefit the organization.
Create prototypes and proof-of-concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AI solutions to stakeholders.
Continuously optimize AI models and algorithms for efficiency and scalability.
Document architecture designs, algorithms, and best practices for knowledge sharing within the organization.
Provide guidance and mentorship to AI ambassadors in the organization, fostering their growth, development, and contribution to AI use in their respective departments.




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proven experience with generative AI.
Please provide sources to your work in your application - You will be asked to demo your experience in the interview process
Interest in both open-source AI frameworks, libraries as well as closed-source projects, having contributed is a strong plus.
Proficiency in machine learning techniques, frameworks, big data, and programming languages.
Proficiency in Swedish




What we offer

Hybrid/remote work environment - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools, we sign agreements with the largest players, and we encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work to form a collaborative environment where AI is used throughout the group.
Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.




Location

We find great value in being able to work closely with our Stockholm-based team in person. At the same time, we understand the need to focus deeply without interruptions. Therefore, the team works according to a hybrid setup with 3 days at the Stockholm office, and 2 days remotely from home, combining the best of both worlds.




Excited?

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.

Show more

Title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Python/Kotlin and React), Privacy
Description:
Job Description

In our data-driven world, safeguarding user privacy is paramount. At Wolt, we are committed to ensuring full compliance with laws, regulations, and industry standards across all our markets while supporting other teams in managing the processes in an efficient and joyful fashion. We're now looking for a Senior Full-stack (back-end and Web) engineer to join a brand new Privacy & Compliance team to be the one of the first members of the team. This is a great opportunity for an experienced engineer who is passionate about user rights, data protection, and building tools to enable others to join us on this critical mission.

The Privacy & Compliance team is an end-to-end team with a Product Lead, an Engineering Team Lead and engineers covering back-end and client domains.

The team will be responsible for:


Developing scalable and robust solutions that integrate seamlessly with company-wide systems to ensure strict adherence to information security policies and procedures for all Wolt countries.
Monitoring and evaluating the adoption of new technologies and data storage methods to maintain privacy compliance.
Leading the charge in defining and implementing best practices for data anonymization, deletion, and protection, and building solutions that help other teams incorporate the practices.


As a member of the team, you'll have the unique opportunity to:


Play a pivotal role in shaping the team's direction and culture from the ground up.
Explore and integrate diverse data flows and storage architectures to create a secure and compliant data ecosystem.
Collaborate closely with engineering teams across the organization to understand their needs and implement effective privacy solutions.
Take ownership of the tools and frameworks that enable data anonymization, deletion, and protection.


Feel free to check the Wolt Tech Blog for more read about our culture & technology here.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - don't worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.

Our humble expectations

We're seeking a highly skilled and motivated engineer who is passionate about safeguarding user data and ensuring strict compliance with privacy regulations. Understanding of data pipelines, storage systems, and data governance is highly desirable. We’d love to see interest and knowledge of relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and industry best practices.

To excel as a Senior Full-Stack Engineer, you'll need several years of experience in back-end development, coupled with an understanding of front-end technologies. We leverage Kotlin, Python, and TypeScript (with React) for our development stack. Our infrastructure relies on MongoDB and PostgreSQL for databases, Git for version control, and Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.

But there's more! We're looking for someone who takes ownership beyond the obvious, is motivated to learn new things and share knowledge and loves collaborating with different teams across the organization.

Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.


Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?




What's in it for you?

You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.

Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.

You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.




What you'd be doing?

You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.

Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.

You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.







About you?

You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI.

You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.

You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.

Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.




A bit about them?

A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.

The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.

With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.







Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to mitch@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.

Show more

Title: Senior MLOps Engineer
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.




We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team, build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.




As a Senior MLOps Engineer, you will lead the transformation of our MLOps platform and will be responsible for reimagining and rebuilding it to enable fast, scalable, and cost-effective machine learning model development and deployment. You will also help set the best ways of working to make the best use of the platform and increase developer productivity. This role is critical to our mission of accelerating model training, deployment, and experimentation. Your work will directly impact our ability to deploy models within hours, support automated machine learning (AutoML), and enable teams across the organization to experiment with and deploy generative AI models.




The impact you will create:

Lead the MLOps transformation in Truecaller by designing and building the infrastructure needed to enable our teams.
Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organization, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
Collaborate closely and support developers throughout the organization to make model training, development, and monitoring fast, scalable, and cost-efficient.
Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in MLOps, AI, and cloud computing, and drive continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.




What you bring in:

5+ years of experience building and maintaining tools and platforms for feature engineering, model training, model deployment, model monitoring, and A/B testing model performance.
Strong programming skills in Python and shell scripting.
A strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
Expertise in infrastructure as code (for example, Terraform).
Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX).
Strong experience in cloud platforms (we use GCP) and cloud-native tools.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
A customer-focused mindset.




It would be great if you also have:

Experience with AutoML tools (for example H2O.ai or Auto-Keras).
Experience enabling generative AI experimentation, fine-tuning, and deployment.
Experience with Go.




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

Show more

We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team, build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.


As a Senior MLOps Engineer, you will lead the transformation of our MLOps platform and will be responsible for reimagining and rebuilding it to enable fast, scalable, and cost-effective machine learning model development and deployment. You will also help set the best ways of working to make the best use of the platform and increase developer productivity. This role is critical to our mission of accelerating model training, deployment, and experimentation. Your work will directly impact our ability to deploy models within hours, support automated machine learning (AutoML), and enable teams across the organization to experiment with and deploy generative AI models.


The impact you will create:

  • Lead the MLOps transformation in Truecaller by designing and building the infrastructure needed to enable our teams.
  • Understand the current and future needs of developers and the organization, and create a roadmap with your manager for meeting those needs.
  • Collaborate closely and support developers throughout the organization to make model training, development, and monitoring fast, scalable, and cost-efficient.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in MLOps, AI, and cloud computing, and drive continuous innovation throughout Truecaller.


What you bring in:

  • 5+ years of experience building and maintaining tools and platforms for feature engineering, model training, model deployment, model monitoring, and A/B testing model performance.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and shell scripting.
  • A strong understanding of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
  • Expertise in infrastructure as code (for example, Terraform).
  • Strong understanding of machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX).
  • Strong experience in cloud platforms (we use GCP) and cloud-native tools.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across different teams and disciplines.
  • A customer-focused mindset.


It would be great if you also have:

  • Experience with AutoML tools (for example H2O.ai or Auto-Keras).
  • Experience enabling generative AI experimentation, fine-tuning, and deployment.
  • Experience with Go.


Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/


Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.


This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.


We only accept applications in English.


What we offer:

  • A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
  • A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
  • Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
  • Do it your way: We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
  • Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There is something for everyone!


Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

Title: Senior Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Join Numiro as a Founding Engineer / AI Engineer 🦄




Company Description




Numiro is a remote-first, VC-funded AI tech startup that is building autonomous co workers for US CPA firms. Numiro automates client intake, client management and tax return preparation for US CPA firms, reducing the need for additional staff and expensive software licenses. Founded by experienced startup leaders with over a decade of expertise, we are passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences. Currently in the seed stage, we are building a world-class team. Future is AI driven and this is a role worth leaving your FAANG job for 🤙




Role Description




Hello there, we are seeking a highly autonomous remote engineer (or based in Stockholm) to build the AI-powered future of tax work.

You'll be an early employee (founding engineer) in a high-impact role where you'll own the design and implementation of core features.







About you







- 🦄 Self-starter. You can get things done without needing existing infrastructure, tooling, or -processes. 

- 🔥 Highly autonomous. You need very little hand holding and can come up with what needs to be done and gets it all done.

- ⚡️ Quick learner. You pick up new tools, technologies and skills very quickly.

- 💰 Resourceful. You figure out how to get things done and overcome obstacles relentlessly

- 🔮 AI-augmented. You are already deeply using AI to 10x yourself.

- 🤩 Customer-obsessed. You sweat the details to delight customers and also know where to move fast to deliver value quickly.







Responsibilities




- 💅 We're seeking an AI superbuilder comfortable getting things done across the entire tech stack. Practical experience developing AI-native apps leveraging ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs is a must.

- 🔭 Design and build features, owning the development of projects.

- 🤝 Contribute to the creation of the team culture, as well as internal tooling and processes.







Hard skills & Tech stack




* Expertise with our stack. We use React, Next.Js, GraphQL and Postgres - everything is written in TypeScript.

* 3+ years of experience building and scaling successful software projects, ideally independently or as a part of a small team or early-stage startup.

* We operate like a sports team and as such have a high bar when it comes to performance. You will work with team members who are striving to be the best!







About our team




Our founding team combines experience from big tech and high-growth fintech / AI startups.




🚀 Leroy Kerry (CEO) has 10+ years as a superstar sales and operations leader in high growth startups. He was the founding member of Juni (fastest growing fintech in 2022 in EU) and the first operator in multiple Seed to Series B startups. He spends any rare free time trying to become better at Chess but still can't break a 1200 ELO.







🦄 Atul R is our powerhouse CTO with over 10+years of experience. He has previously led teams at McKinsey & Company, PayPal and Anyfin (Swedish fintech). He is known for his open source work in Github with projects gathering more than 15k+ stars. Whether it's board games or sports, count him in—he's always up for a good time!







Join us in once-in-a-generation opportunity to build the next generation of software to transform an old but essential industry 🚀🔥

Show more

Title: AI Engineer to Mynewsdesk
Description:
Are you an AI Engineer who enjoys building practical features that provide real value to users?

Join Mynewsdesk—the leading PR platform in the Nordics—to develop intelligent solutions that enhance our platform for thousands daily.

What is it like to work at Mynewsdesk?

Mynewsdesk is an international workplace with around 15 developers of diverse expertise split into different teams. The teams collaborate closely with product managers, designers, data scientists, and test engineers to drive innovation and success. We promote a challenger culture where individuals and teams are encouraged to think outside the box.

We believe that you perform at your best when working on tasks that are both fun and challenging. To support this, we have separate working tracks led by a product manager and teams guided by a technical engineering manager. You have the flexibility to choose and switch between different tracks or focus on a specific technical project if you prefer.

Our Stack

Our tech stack is built mainly with Ruby on Rails in the backend, React in the frontend, and GraphQL in between. Our AI and data analysis stack that daily processes large datasets of media monitoring data is based on Python with frameworks. We use databases like Postgresql, Clickhouse and Elasticsearch to store and query our data. For effective collaboration, we use standard tools such as GitHub, Jira, Slack, and G-Suite.

What will you do?


Develop AI Solutions: Design and implement AI features to enhance content generation, media analysis, recommendations and other parts of our product.
Prompt Engineering: Create and refine prompts to optimize the performance of LLMs for various tasks.
Integrate AI into the Platform: Work closely with product managers, designers, and developers to integrate AI into our product suite..
Evaluate and Optimize Models: Evaluate LLM models to ensure efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
Stay Updated: Keep up-to-date on the latest advancements in AI, particularly in LLMs and natural language processing.
Collaborate and Share Knowledge: Coach other developers in AI best practices and contribute to company growth.
Contribute to Platform Enhancement: Participate in discussions and implementations to improve our platform’s features and performance.


Who are you?


Experienced with LLMs: You have hands-on experience working with Large Language Models to solve customer needs and understand how popular models behave differently.
Proficient in Python: Preferably comfortable with Python and familiar with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Langchain.
Skilled in Prompt Engineering: Experience in iterative prompt engineering to allow AI models to solve complex tasks efficiently at scale.
Proficient in databases: You have hands-on experience working with relational and search-oriented databases like PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch to manage large-scale data.
Integration Skills: You have experience in integrating AI solutions into applications built with Ruby and Node.js.
Quality-Focused: Proud of your work and know how to balance quality with timely delivery.
Product Enthusiast: Passionate about product development and enjoy seeing your solutions quickly deployed to production.
Professional experience: +2 years
Language Skills: Fluent in English; Swedish is a strong plus.
Availability: Able to work from our Stockholm office 2 days a week.


Apply now and let’s grow together! 🌟

We have fun, we are challengers, and we provide a market-leading PR platform.

Answer the questions in the application process and preferably apply with your LinkedIn profile. No CV or cover letter is required.

We look forward to receiving your application! 🌟

Questions?

Feel free to contact Talent Acquisition Manager linda.stuve@mynewsdesk.com

Mynewsdesk is a true pioneer, providing communicators with a modern digital PR service. With just one click, you can give the right audiences direct access to relevant press releases, blog posts, social media feeds, high-resolution images and graphics, videos, and more – at the right time. Influencers can start following your newsroom, engage with content, and become part of a network of influencers.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Epidemic Sound, we make soundtracking content simple and inspiring with unlimited access to music and sound effects. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices all over the world, we are a force of over 500 on a mission to soundtrack the world. Our innovative licensing model paves the way for creators - from YouTubers to small business to the world’s most recognizable brands - to use sound to enhance their content while simultaneously supporting artists both financially and creatively. Epidemic Sound music is heard 2 billion times a day on YouTube alone and is recognized as one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies by the Financial Times. Epidemic Sound is backed by EQT, Blackstone, Creandum, Atwater Capital to name a few.




We’re now looking for an experienced and skilled Machine Learning Engineer to further strengthen the team.




In this position, you will be working on applying machine learning to improve the search and discovery capabilities in our product and drive value for our users. We have already built a number of ML powered applications that are highly appreciated by our users, with examples including intelligent search features such as semantic, and audio-similarity-based search, recommender systems, tagging and previews of music.




You will take a leading role in a team that is solving problems at the core of Epidemic’s products. We are at the beginning of our journey to deliver the very best search experiences for our users. We are agile, user focused and passionate about building a high quality product and, most importantly, we make sure to learn from each other and have a lot of fun on the way!




How you will make an impact

Building features at the very core of how our users get value from Epidemic.
From idea to production, your team owns projects and maintains the systems in production.
Build prototypes, conduct experiments, and operationalize solutions at scale.
Continue to foster a curious and explorative culture in a collaborative environment.
Initiate and drive projects to success together with your team.
Improve technical processes and tooling.
Coach and mentor team members and staff from other teams.




Who you are

Computer Science and Machine Learning with results in industry or academia.
Working as a Machine Learning Engineer in somewhat advanced stages.
Architecting, developing, deploying and monitoring software systems, preferably in Python.




Furthermore, it would be music to our ears if you have experience with:

Building search products.
Adapting/Fine-tuning foundation models to downstream applications.
Applying methods from Music Information Retrieval (MIR), especially using modern architectures.




Equal Opportunity Employer

We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.




Application

Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.

Show more

Title: Developer Advocate/Python Dev
Description:
Triform is a cutting-edge DevOps platform specializing in Python-based large language model (LLM) implementations, located in the heart of Stockholm. We are dedicated to democratizing scalable AI solutions by making implementation, integration, and orchestration accessible to developers, businesses, and innovators alike. Our mission is to empower teams to seamlessly scale AI-powered workflows, unlocking new possibilities through simplified yet powerful automation tools.




Developer Advocate/Python Developer Role Description

Role Overview:

We’re looking for a full-time Developer Advocate / Python Developer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm. This hybrid role combines hands-on software development with strategic advocacy for our platform, making it ideal for a Python developer with a passion for technology evangelism and customer engagement.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the development team to build and improve the Triform platform
Engage in presales activities to demonstrate the value of Triform’s tools
Integrate our platform with other systems, providing technical support and strategy to potential customers
Provide in-depth technical programming support in Python, focusing on AI implementations
Contribute to product strategy and development to ensure customer and community success
Act as an advocate for developers, helping them succeed with Triform through educational content, tutorials, and presentations




Qualifications:

Proficiency in Python and experience with relevant frameworks
Background in software development, particularly in AI, LLM, or DevOps
Experience in presales, integration, and technical support
Ability to devise effective strategies and development roadmaps
Strong communication skills and the ability to explain technical details to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proven problem-solving and analytical abilities
Experience working with AI/ML implementations is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
Show more

Title: AI Backend Developer
Description:
Are you looking for a role within an exciting world of AI technologies, where you can both contribute with your expertise and keep on developing?

We are starting a new chapter within ASSA ABLOY’s organization, and we are looking for top talent to help us grow our AI Technical Development Teams from scratch.

Join our Team in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.

What Would You Do As Our AI Backend Developer

You would be a leading AI Backend Developer in our new project that deals with AI Technical Development, working with our new Team of Engineers in Stockholm. We have cross-functional teams that create modern, secure and high-quality solutions. We develop embedded applications and connect them with Mobile Applications, Electronic Access Control software using cloud and microservice architecture.

You would also:


Stay up to date with the latest AI technologies.
Be responsible for hands-on RND Development including Cloud infrastructure development, DevOps, Databases and security.
Interact with tech- and non-tech stakeholders.


The Skills And Experience You Need

We are looking for someone who:


has previous experience in building both backend applications and cloud infrastructure.
understands AI solutions and knows how to use them.
has experience with Microservices, Docker & Containers, as well as databases.
has experience for working in a DevOps team, within an agile environment.
is fluent in English, spoken and written.


Our code is written in Python – hands-on experience with Python will be beneficial but isn’t a must-have.

We review applications regularly, so don’t wait

We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.

To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.

Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com

We are the ASSA ABLOY Group

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer - Recent Graduate
Description:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
What you need to know about the role As a Software Engineer in the Unified Purchases team, you will be working on providing a seamless experience between the Zettle by PayPal card processing and Point-of-Sale offerings, and the entire PayPal online library. Meet our team You will join a dynamic team of experienced backend software engineers, led by an Engineering Manager and Product Manager. As part of this team, you'll collaborate with global teams across Zettle and PayPal, contributing to innovative projects with a global impact. Our team focuses exclusively on backend development, primarily using Java and Kotlin to deliver high-performance, scalable solutions. Location: Stockholm, Sweden. Full time position, starting April 2025.

Job Description:
Company Overview:

Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 392 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

About Us:

In 2018, Zettle joined forces with PayPal to go further in its mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. By offering them easy tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we are empowering merchants from all over the world to reach their full potential. Our journey in putting an end to ordinary is just starting. Together, we’re extraordinary. Together, we’re made for more and the best is yet to come. Are you in?

Your day to day

You will be collaborating with your engineering team and product manager to set requirements, design, and implement solutions. Together with your teammates, you'll ensure your code meets quality standards and is successfully deployed to production, enhancing our customers' experience

What Do You Need To Bring

Engineering graduate-level experience in Java and backend systems. Having a personal Java project or any other relevant work that highlights your skills and makes you stand out is a plus.
A positive attitude and high energy. We're excited to have you on the team to help us grow and learn together.
Willingness and motivation to learn, with a curious and inquisitive mindset.
We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don't hesitate to apply.



globaluniversitygraduatesoftwareengineering

For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

REQ ID R0116478

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar i en innovativ och snabbväxande miljö? Agria söker en driven Data Scientist med fokus på AI, NLP och intelligenta system. Hos oss får du möjligheten att spela en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av skräddarsydda AI-lösningar som gör skillnad.

Om jobbet

Agria är marknadsledande inom djurförsäkringar i Norden och siktar på att bli störst i Europa. Vår framgång bygger på innovation, snabbhet och kundfokus. För att nå våra mål bygger vi en affärsagil organisation som kombinerar IT och affärsverksamhet för snabbare och mer innovativa lösningar. I denna position kommer du att arbeta med avancerade AI-lösningar, där särskilt fokus ligger på naturlig språkbehandling (NLP) och utveckling av intelligenta system, chatbotar och språkmodeller. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att utveckla och implementera skräddarsydda AI-lösningar med hjälp av Python och moderna verktyg och tekniker, främst inom Azure. Rollen innebär även arbete med bildigenkänning och samarbete med övrig utveckling för att säkerställa att lösningarna hänger ihop i en helhet både frontend och backend.

Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:


Utveckla och implementera avancerade AI-lösningar med fokus på NLP och intelligenta system.
Bygga och optimera chatbotar och språkmodeller.
Använda Python och dess ekosystem för att skapa skräddarsydda lösningar.
Arbeta med bildigenkänning och relaterade AI-tekniker.
Samarbeta med andra utvecklingsteam för att säkerställa en integrerad lösning mellan frontend och backend.
Använda Microsoft Azure och Azure DevOps för att automatisera och optimera CI/CD pipelines.
Delta i projekt som kombinerar IT och affärsverksamhet för att leverera innovativa lösningar med hög kvalitet.


Vem är du?

Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik för denna tjänst:


God tidigare erfarenhet som Data Scientist eller snarlikt.
Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och dess ekosystem.
Allmän erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
Erfarenhet inom Naturlig språkbehandling (NLP) och AI-utveckling.
Erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera chatbotar och språkmodeller.
Erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure.
Kunskaper inom Azure DevOps, med fokus på automatisering och CI/CD pipelines.
Kunskaper inom bildigenkänning och relaterade AI-tekniker.


Meriterande är även om du har:


Erfarenhet av att arbeta med skadehantering inom försäkringsbranschen.
Erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling.


Som person är du självgående och trivs med att arbeta i mindre team där stort ansvar och drivkraft för att leda egna projekt framåt är avgörande. Nyfikenhet och analytisk förmåga är viktiga egenskaper, och du finner glädje i att lösa svåra problem. Förmågan att snabbt sätta dig in i nya teknologier och metoder gör att du ständigt utvecklas och bidrar till teamets framgång. Stark kommunikativ förmåga är ett måste, särskilt när det gäller att förklara komplexa tekniska koncept på ett lättförståeligt sätt för både kollegor och kunder. Att ligga i framkant inom ditt område och att dela med dig av insikter och kunskaper till resten av teamet är något som driver dig.

Om oss

Välkommen till Agria Djurförsäkring – en plats där vi skapar trygghet för djur och människor. Allt vi gör, gör vi för djuren. Det genomsyrar hela vår medarbetarkultur och märks i alla beslut vi fattar. Vi tror på att människor med en genuin passion för djur är nyckeln till att förmedla vårt erbjudande och att upprätthålla våra mål, mission och löften.

Vi vill bidra till en kreativ och lärande miljö där du som vill utveckla dig själv och verksamheten ska kunna göra det. En miljö där vi som arbetsgivare ger dig rätt stöd och ledarskap. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande arbetsplats att trivas i och vi välkomnar alla, oavsett bakgrund.

Agria växer i Europa och har idag verksamhet i Sverige, Norge, Finland, Danmark, Storbritannien, Tyskland, Frankrike, Irland och Nederländerna. På Agria arbetar cirka 650 medarbetare. I koncernen ingår även dotterbolaget Agria Vet Guide som erbjuder digital veterinärrådgivning. Var med oss på resan att skapa Europas största och mest valbara djurförsäkringsbolag för att skapa trygghet för fler djur och människor.

Hos oss får du möjligheten att utvecklas i en innovativ och snabbväxande miljö, där du får arbeta med banbrytande teknik och vara med och forma framtidens AI-lösningar.

Mer information

Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.

Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-24

Title: Data scientist med inriktning mot penningmarknadsdata, vikariat
Description:
Är du en engagerad och ansvarstagande person som vill jobba med att framställa och tillgängliggöra data och statistik inom penningmarknadssområdet? Gillar du samhällsekonomiska frågor och vill bidra till en god utveckling i samhället? Då är det här en tjänst för dig!

VI ERBJUDER DIG

Du ingår i ett team som arbetar utifrån agila principer med en stor grad av tvärfunktionell samverkan. Den löpande produktionen sker parallellt med kontinuerligt utvecklingsarbete för att effektivisera statistikarbetet och för att höja kvaliteten i statistiken. Teamet utvecklar nya automatiserade dataflöden i Python och vi är på väg över till en ny datamiljö i Linux där vi arbetar containerbaserat. Vi är också starkt bidragande till bankens utveckling inom dataområdet och är drivande i flera initiativ. Det ger varierade arbetsuppgifter och skapar möjlighet till utveckling inom flera områden.

DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS

Tjänsten handlar i första hand om att samla in, bearbeta, analysera och tillgängliggöra penningmarknadsstatistik. I rollen ingår att ansvara för daglig beräkning och publicering av referensräntan Swestr, löpande arbeta med omsättningsstatistik på penning- och valutamarknaden samt publicera räntor, valutakurser och index. Utöver det löpande arbetet i linjen kommer du även ingå i olika tvärfunktionella utvecklingsinitiav för att vidareutveckla vårt data- och statistikarbete i den nya datamiljön.

Du kommer arbeta med stora, komplicerade och i många fall detaljerade datamängder som ger en unik inblick i det finansiella systemet.

DITT TEAM

Riksbanken består av åtta avdelningar. Enheten för finansiell data och utvecking tillhör avdelningen för penningpolitik. Här kan du läsa mer om Riksbankens organisation.

Enheten för finansiell data och utveckling består idag av 14 personer. Enheten ansvarar för dataproduktionen av finansiella data som Riksbanken samlar in och leder utveckling av Riksbankens datahantering. Du arbetar tillsammans med ekonomer och dataspecialister (data scientists/engineers). Förutom kollegorna på enheten sker arbetet avdelningsöverskridande inom banken och teamet har även löpande kontakt med de banker och företag som rapporterar in statistik till Riksbanken. Teamet har även regelbundna kontakter med andra myndigheter som Finansinspektionen samt med internationella organisationer, såsom ECB och BIS.

MER OM DIG

I den här rollen söker vi dig som gillar att samla in, kvalitetssäkra och strukturera data för olika typer av analyser. Du har en relevant akademisk examen (tex med inriktning mot ekonomi, datateknik, matematik, programmering eller liknande) och har erfarenhet av att hantera och analysera data. Du kan bearbeta data programmatiskt med stöd av Python eller R och har erfarenhet av att använda verktyg för att versionshantera kod såsom GitHub. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl skriftligen som muntligen.

Utöver Dessa Grundkrav Ser Vi Gärna Att Du Har Ett Intresse Av Finansiella Marknader Samt Erfarenhet Inom Någon Eller Några Av Följande Områden


arbete med finansiell statistik eller finansiella data
utveckla och hantera dataflöden i orkestreringsverktyg såsom Dagster, Airflow, Prefect eller liknande
arbeta med data i data lake-miljöer exempelvis MinIO och LakeFS


Vi söker personer som är kvalitetsmedvetna, ansvarsfulla, analytiska, har gott omdöme och är bra på att samarbeta och kommunicera. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

MER OM TJÄNSTEN

Tillträde: Omgående eller Enligt överenskommelse

Anställningstyp: Vikariat, till och med 2025-09-30

Placering: Huvudkontoret centrala Stockholm

Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid men tjänsten förutsätter att du regelbundet, ett par dagar i veckan, har möjlighet att påbörja din arbetsdag ca klockan 07.00.

Möjlighet att jobba distans: 2 dagar i veckan

Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, subventionerad lunch, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass.

Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.

ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN

Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi. Här får du utmaning och utveckling varje dag i en händelserik miljö. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Riksbanken här .

ANSÖK

Vi vill ha din ansökan med CV senast den 21 oktober . Vi vill att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. På så vis kan du enkelt söka tjänsten och vi ges möjligheten att utvärdera våra kandidater på lika villkor. Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att vi kontrollerar examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning.

Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken här . Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

Vi har valt annonseringskanaler och undanber oss försäljare av rekryteringstjänster och annonser.
Show more
HTML:
Är du en engagerad och ansvarstagande person som vill jobba med att framställa och tillgängliggöra data och statistik inom penningmarknadssområdet? Gillar du samhällsekonomiska frågor och vill bidra till en god utveckling i samhället? Då är det här en tjänst för dig!

VI ERBJUDER DIG

Du ingår i ett team som arbetar utifrån agila principer med en stor grad av tvärfunktionell samverkan. Den löpande produktionen sker parallellt med kontinuerligt utvecklingsarbete för att effektivisera statistikarbetet och för att höja kvaliteten i statistiken. Teamet utvecklar nya automatiserade dataflöden i Python och vi är på väg över till en ny datamiljö i Linux där vi arbetar containerbaserat. Vi är också starkt bidragande till bankens utveckling inom dataområdet och är drivande i flera initiativ. Det ger varierade arbetsuppgifter och skapar möjlighet till utveckling inom flera områden.

DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS

Tjänsten handlar i första hand om att samla in, bearbeta, analysera och tillgängliggöra penningmarknadsstatistik. I rollen ingår att ansvara för daglig beräkning och publicering av referensräntan Swestr, löpande arbeta med omsättningsstatistik på penning- och valutamarknaden samt publicera räntor, valutakurser och index. Utöver det löpande arbetet i linjen kommer du även ingå i olika tvärfunktionella utvecklingsinitiav för att vidareutveckla vårt data- och statistikarbete i den nya datamiljön.

Du kommer arbeta med stora, komplicerade och i många fall detaljerade datamängder som ger en unik inblick i det finansiella systemet.

DITT TEAM

Riksbanken består av åtta avdelningar. Enheten för finansiell data och utvecking tillhör avdelningen för penningpolitik. Här kan du läsa mer om Riksbankens organisation.

Enheten för finansiell data och utveckling består idag av 14 personer. Enheten ansvarar för dataproduktionen av finansiella data som Riksbanken samlar in och leder utveckling av Riksbankens datahantering. Du arbetar tillsammans med ekonomer och dataspecialister (data scientists/engineers). Förutom kollegorna på enheten sker arbetet avdelningsöverskridande inom banken och teamet har även löpande kontakt med de banker och företag som rapporterar in statistik till Riksbanken. Teamet har även regelbundna kontakter med andra myndigheter som Finansinspektionen samt med internationella organisationer, såsom ECB och BIS.

MER OM DIG

I den här rollen söker vi dig som gillar att samla in, kvalitetssäkra och strukturera data för olika typer av analyser. Du har en relevant akademisk examen (tex med inriktning mot ekonomi, datateknik, matematik, programmering eller liknande) och har erfarenhet av att hantera och analysera data. Du kan bearbeta data programmatiskt med stöd av Python eller R och har erfarenhet av att använda verktyg för att versionshantera kod såsom GitHub. Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl skriftligen som muntligen.

Utöver Dessa Grundkrav Ser Vi Gärna Att Du Har Ett Intresse Av Finansiella Marknader Samt Erfarenhet Inom Någon Eller Några Av Följande Områden

  • arbete med finansiell statistik eller finansiella data
  • utveckla och hantera dataflöden i orkestreringsverktyg såsom Dagster, Airflow, Prefect eller liknande
  • arbeta med data i data lake-miljöer exempelvis MinIO och LakeFS

Vi söker personer som är kvalitetsmedvetna, ansvarsfulla, analytiska, har gott omdöme och är bra på att samarbeta och kommunicera. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

MER OM TJÄNSTEN

Tillträde: Omgående eller Enligt överenskommelse

Anställningstyp: Vikariat, till och med 2025-09-30

Placering: Huvudkontoret centrala Stockholm

Arbetstid: Förtroendearbetstid men tjänsten förutsätter att du regelbundet, ett par dagar i veckan, har möjlighet att påbörja din arbetsdag ca klockan 07.00.

Möjlighet att jobba distans: 2 dagar i veckan

Förmåner: Generösa semestervillkor, subventionerad lunch, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass.

Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll, säkerhetsprövningssamtal och särskild personutredning görs då för slutkandidaten. För vissa tjänster ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap.

ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN

Riksbanken är en myndighet under riksdagen som ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi. Här får du utmaning och utveckling varje dag i en händelserik miljö. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Riksbanken här .

ANSÖK

Vi vill ha din ansökan med CV senast den 21 oktober . Vi vill att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. På så vis kan du enkelt söka tjänsten och vi ges möjligheten att utvärdera våra kandidater på lika villkor. Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att vi kontrollerar examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning.

Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken här . Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

Vi har valt annonseringskanaler och undanber oss försäljare av rekryteringstjänster och annonser.

Title: Kotlin Backend Engineers
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for talented Mid-level and Senior Backend Engineers with experience in Kotlin or any other JVM backend languages like Java and Scala, to join several different Engineering Groups.

Our Engineering organization at Wolt consists of 700+ Engineers working across 70+ product teams. Some of us work on the visible parts, making our services easy on the eye and some of us focus on the unseen magic happening behind the scenes. ✨

Our Engineers handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) in an autonomous manner. They build things that are accessible and made to scale. They keep our systems in the best shape by simplifying the unnecessary complexity.

We make the decisions as a team and group of teams for our ways of working and we take architectural decisions together. Everyone plays a role in our future.

Our Engineers choose the best technologies that work for Wolt, their teams and themselves. Making good choices means finding scalable, robust technology that works in everyone’s best interests. The freedom to experiment and adopt the best technology benefits everyone.

The main stack for these roles consists for example Kotlin (Ktor, Koin, Spring, grpc…), PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Kafka, Redis, GitHub Actions, AWS, Docker and Kubernetes.

Needless to say, in such an environment there’s a lot of room for learning, teaching and growing together!

Go ahead and check our Kotlin related Tech Talks below.

The very fresh Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast

Kotlin at Wolt

Kotlin Meetup

FinTech Group: dedicated to shaping the future of financial services at Wolt. 🚀 Our Fintech teams play a critical role in enabling smooth and automated money flows for our customers, merchants, and courier partners as well as delivering financial products to them. To meet local requirements and provide the best financial solutions, our Fintech engineering teams are at the forefront of building integrations and automating financial processes for local country teams, supporting expansion in our existing markets and into new ones.

We currently have multiple roles in our Fintech Teams, and depending on your experience, we will make sure to find the right team for you if you love working with modern technologies like Kotlin, are always open to learning new things, find motivation in working with skilled and nice colleagues, and don't shy away from highly challenging engineering topics, you'll fit right in! 💡👩‍💻

Merchant Integrations: Running a restaurant or a store while fulfilling delivery orders is hard work that can be made easy with automation. This is where our integration platform comes in. We help our merchant partners automate the manual work with our API and integration offerings. Once a merchant has these integrations in place, their staff are free to do what they do best - service consumers without being bogged down by mundane, repetitive, and error prone manual processes. Through our API platform, we ensure that the experience for our partners is best in class, making it a breeze to work with Wolt. Be it orders going to POS (Point of Sale) systems automatically, venue management, item & inventory control, menu & catalog automation, our teams have our merchants covered!

Merchant Operations: In recent years, we started expanding our delivery offering to new verticals beyond restaurant deliveries, including grocery, pharmacy, merchandise, flowers, and apparel, all referred to as “Retail”. That meant quite many new services and technical improvements as use cases and flows are more complex than ever. Our Merchant Operations subgroup consists of 4 different teams full of smart engineers creating new solutions to enhance our operational abilities with Merchants. Here, we build merchant applications that help merchants run their day-to-day operations. We also build all the relevant tooling from Product Catalog to Offer Management systems to make sure we can capture the full assortment of the merchants in the easiest way possible.

Merchant Engagement: Engagement focuses on Acquiring more quality Merchants and reducing the time and effort it takes to onboard them so they can make their first sales on Wolt. The group also aims to make best-in-industry self-service experiences for onboarding & Imaging, a unified Merchant portal where you can get everything you need done, and insights dashboard to help maximize business performance

Retail Platforms (Wolt Market): Last year we took a leap forward with a dedicated product offering for Wolt Market - Retail Platforms. Wolt Market is a chain of dark grocery stores available on Wolt’s well known delivery platform. Wolt Market delivers groceries to our users within 30 minutes. We successfully built from scratch several teams of talented Engineers, Product Leads and Designers building internal tooling within the areas like warehousing, assortment, catalog and pricing.

Consumer Group: As the name Consumer Group implies, we are responsible for building and developing Wolt’s consumer-facing products. Our mission is to master the user experience while scaling up the platform to enable delivering a mall in your pocket. We’re humbled and proud to say our apps have the industry’s highest ratings in the App Store (4.8) and Google Play (4.6). We believe that a great user experience enables healthy top-line growth. We make sure our users find the right content from the platform and convert. We are here in the long term by retaining our customers and keeping them engaged. Currently, the Consumer Group is growing especially in the front of AdTech and Search functions making sure we succeed in the above-mentioned mission.

📍These open roles can be based in all of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm, or Berlin. This can vary depending on the exact team and their main location. You can choose whether you want to work from home, from the office or hybrid.

Our humble expectations

We'd love to see experience with Kotlin or any other JVM backend languages like Java and Scala but encourage you to convince us about your learning abilities if you come from a different background. 🛠️

As a member of our team, you'll dive into the world of microservices, primarily using Kotlin, while remaining open to exploring other modern languages, such as Python, in some teams. We appreciate previous experience in handling the whole development cycle all the way to production.

But what truly sets you apart is your ability to tackle big challenges together, envision scalability and availability, and dare to question conventional decisions. You’ll be successful in our teams if you quickly grasp new concepts and thrive in an environment of continuous learning.🌟

We put a lot of focus on the ability to collaborate well with others. We work closely with our teammates and having a good connection with team members is essential. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others. We expect you to be yourself, express your opinions, and work together with the rest of the team.

In addition to technical expertise, we cherish those who take ownership beyond the obvious, have an insatiable hunger for knowledge, make collaborative decisions, and enthusiastically collaborate with diverse teams Woltwide. We value the unique perspectives and skills you bring to our adventure, and we're excited to see what you can achieve with us!👥🚀

Next Steps

We are hiring for a number of open positions across a few different Engineering Groups. During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about different teams. After the recruiter screening call, the interviewing steps are conducted for a particular group in mind, with a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll latest get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills and aspirations with the most suitable Engineering team at Wolt!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola severi.kausola(at)wolt.com

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.
