Title: ML Ops Engineer, Solna/Hybrid
Description:
Do you want to be part of our in-house Machine Learning team and take part in PostNord’s digital transformation journey? Do you wish to work hands-on across the whole data engineering area? Then you should apply for this position as a ML Ops Engineer!

Responsibilities

PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas, such as e.g. HR, mail and logistics. We are already delivering business critical forecasting models that are an important piece of the puzzle of optimizing our operations. Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platforms to Azure. We are now using that platform to train our ML models on our data sets to enable data-driven decision making.

Our technology is focused on the Azure stack, and includes Azure MLW, Azure ML, Azure DevOps, Power BI etc.

The Machine Learning team’s main responsibility is to develop and operate ML models used by PostNord production units. As an ML Ops engineer, your role is hands-on, focusing on operating and optimizing our ML workloads and model releases.

As an ML Ops Engineer you will lead and direct the teams DevOps practices, including version controlling and managing the teams repos.

You will be responsible for improving our monitoring/alerting systems for our ML workloads.

You'll work closely with a team of data scientists to monitor and improve model accuracy, prevent drift, and improve the cloud infrastructure.

Qualifications

To fit in the ML Ops Engineer role at PostNord you have been working with software development on an advanced level for several years. It is important that you like to remain hands on, able to take a lead role and enjoy working on complex and challenging solutions.

You have a structured approach to code management and can help the team develop code according to best practices.

As a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state of the art pace in the domain that you work in.

We Are Looking For You Who Have


Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
Communication skills in both written and spoken English
5+ years of experience in data engineering, CI/CD, DevOps, or ML Ops (preferably in an Azure environment).
Expert skills in version controlling, source code management and artifact management.
Experience with ML Ops workflows and DevOps practices, including model versioning, automated model retraining, and monitoring.
Familiar with AI/ML concepts and algorithms.
Implemented ML Ops best practices such as model drift detection and model governance.


Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)


Experience working in an agile team
Deep understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
Experience with forecasting and knowledge of time series analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
Experience in defining data models, schemas, and structures for efficient storage and retrieval of data.
Azure or AWS Certified.
Communication skills in both written and spoken Swedish.
Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.
Experienced in Azure DevOps, ADF, metadata-driven pipelines, Azure Data bricks, ARM templates, and Azure Functions.


We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to visit on site on a regular basis.

We Offer You


Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment
Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center (Solna).
Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
Great occupational pension terms.
Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
Employment in Solna/Hybrid.


Welcome with your application!

Selection is ongoing and we want your application as soon as possible. For questions about the role contact us through our recruitment platform Varbi.

About PostNord Group AB

We make everyday life easier! PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal- and logistic services to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com

For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

Responsibilities

PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas, such as e.g. HR, mail and logistics. We are already delivering business critical forecasting models that are an important piece of the puzzle of optimizing our operations. Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platforms to Azure. We are now using that platform to train our ML models on our data sets to enable data-driven decision making.

Our technology is focused on the Azure stack, and includes Azure MLW, Azure ML, Azure DevOps, Power BI etc.

The Machine Learning team’s main responsibility is to develop and operate ML models used by PostNord production units. As an ML Ops engineer, your role is hands-on, focusing on operating and optimizing our ML workloads and model releases.

As an ML Ops Engineer you will lead and direct the teams DevOps practices, including version controlling and managing the teams repos.

You will be responsible for improving our monitoring/alerting systems for our ML workloads.

You'll work closely with a team of data scientists to monitor and improve model accuracy, prevent drift, and improve the cloud infrastructure.

Qualifications

To fit in the ML Ops Engineer role at PostNord you have been working with software development on an advanced level for several years. It is important that you like to remain hands on, able to take a lead role and enjoy working on complex and challenging solutions.

You have a structured approach to code management and can help the team develop code according to best practices.

As a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state of the art pace in the domain that you work in.

We Are Looking For You Who Have

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field.
  • Communication skills in both written and spoken English
  • 5+ years of experience in data engineering, CI/CD, DevOps, or ML Ops (preferably in an Azure environment).
  • Expert skills in version controlling, source code management and artifact management.
  • Experience with ML Ops workflows and DevOps practices, including model versioning, automated model retraining, and monitoring.
  • Familiar with AI/ML concepts and algorithms.
  • Implemented ML Ops best practices such as model drift detection and model governance.

Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)

  • Experience working in an agile team
  • Deep understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
  • Experience with forecasting and knowledge of time series analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
  • Experience in defining data models, schemas, and structures for efficient storage and retrieval of data.
  • Azure or AWS Certified.
  • Communication skills in both written and spoken Swedish.
  • Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.
  • Experienced in Azure DevOps, ADF, metadata-driven pipelines, Azure Data bricks, ARM templates, and Azure Functions.

We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to visit on site on a regular basis.

We Offer You

  • Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment
  • Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center (Solna).
  • Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
  • Great occupational pension terms.
  • Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
  • Employment in Solna/Hybrid.

Welcome with your application!

Selection is ongoing and we want your application as soon as possible. For questions about the role contact us through our recruitment platform Varbi.

About PostNord Group AB

We make everyday life easier! PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal- and logistic services to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com

For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

Title: Researcher till Pokayoke Stockholm
Description:
Pokayoke satsar vidare mot målet att bli branschledare för rekrytering och konsulter i logistiksverige. Varteftersom allt fler kunder får upp ögonen för vår verksamhet ökar också antalet förfrågningar. Vårt rekryteringsteam för denna typ av tjänster behöver därför bli fler. Vi söker nu nästa stjärna för en tjänst som researcher till vårt team.

I rollen kommer du:


få jobba med spännande uppdrag och kunder
få vara med på en tillväxtresa med möjlighet till karriär och utveckling
få jobba med fantastiska kollegor som delar ditt driv, engagemang och förmåga att göra skillnad


Om tjänsten

I rollen som Researcher blir du en viktig nyckelspelare i varje rekryteringsprocess. Du jobbar nära övriga i rekryteringsteamet i de processer vi söker kandidater till. Vi har stort fokus på att jobba proaktivt mot tjänster vi vet är på gång och har som målsättning att alltid ligga steget före. Vår erfarenhet är att uppdragen gärna ska tillsättas så snart som möjligt efter att förfrågan kommit oss tillhanda. Vi utför arbetet med hög energi och kvalitet, samarbete och arbetsglädje.

Som researcher arbetar du främst med de första stegen i rekryteringsprocessen, den fas som ofta kallas searchfasen. Du är med i våra möten med kund för att få en djupare förståelse av uppdraget, arbetsgivaren och rollen. Därefter börjar din viktiga uppgift att genomföra kartläggning, search och urval,samt ansvara för den inledande dialogen med potentiella kandidater. I rollen ingår därtill att kartlägga och analysera olika branscher och sektorer, skriva uppdragsbeskrivningar samt genomföra telefonintervjuer. Du bidrar i kundmöten vid försäljning av nya uppdrag samt vid kontinuerliga presentationer och avstämningar under processens gång.

Vår kärnverksamhet är inriktad på att hitta rätt kandidater till våra kunders behov. Därför är engagemang, professionalism och relationsskapande förmåga otroligt viktiga komponenter för att du ska lyckas i din roll. Som researcher kommer du att ansvara för att hålla kontinuerlig kontakt med både kunder och kandidater och skapa dig ett stort kontaktnät för att skapa de bästa möjliga förutsättningarna för att kunna matcha rätt kandidat med rätt arbets-/uppdragsgivare.

Kvalifikationer


Gillar att skapa relationer och bygga nätverk
Erfarenhet av att skriva annonser och av att screena kandidater
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


Personliga egenskaper

För att lyckas och trivas ser vi att du är en ambitiös och driven person som är villig att lägga in en extra växel när det behövs. Du är självgående samt har en god förmåga att arbeta i team. Du har en lösningsorienterad approach och är inte rädd att ta för dig. Vidare har du både en kommunikativ och analytisk förmåga som bidrar till att du snabbt sätter dig in i nya arbetsuppgifter. Du brinner för att leverera med hög kvalitet och ser dig själv som duktig på att hantera relationer såväl internt som externt!

Vi sätter stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. För att passa för rollen och hos oss behöver du gilla att ha kontakt med människor och vara en duktig på att kommunicera. Du jobbar med hög energi, hittar lösningar på problem och bidrar till ett positivt arbetsklimat och teamkänsla. I jobbet kommer du att ständigt att få sätta dig in i nya tjänster, därför behöver du vara nyfiken och intresserad av att förstå verksamheter och organisationer och sätta dig in i nya områden.

Alla frågor avseende tjänsten hänvisas till Erik Skotte, Head of Executive Search & Sales på esk@pokayoke.se eller 0766-23 23 52.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Show more

Du jobbar med hög energi, hittar lösningar på problem och bidrar till ett positivt arbetsklimat och teamkänsla. I jobbet kommer du att ständigt att få sätta dig in i nya tjänster, därför behöver du vara nyfiken och intresserad av att förstå verksamheter och organisationer och sätta dig in i nya områden.

Alla frågor avseende tjänsten hänvisas till Erik Skotte, Head of Executive Search & Sales på esk@pokayoke.se eller 0766-23 23 52.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Title: Senior Backend Developer (Python)
Description:
Senior Backend Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid

Are you passionate about building innovative backend solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products with a focus on robust backend systems?




What's in it for you?

You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on backend development, allowing you to dive deep into complex systems and data infrastructure.




Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.




You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.




What you'd be doing?

You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.




Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers. Key technologies you'll work with include Python, Django, FastAPI, Kubernetes, Airflow, PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, Kafka, and RabbitMQ.




You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable backend systems, optimising performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.







About you?

You have at least 4 years of experience in backend development, with a strong focus on Python and frameworks such as Django and FastAPI. You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.




You’d have experience with DevOps practices (like Kubernetes, Docker, Git), cloud platforms (like AWS/Azure), and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools. Leadership experience and strong communication skills would also be good here, as you'll be able to mentor team members and interface with clients whilst contributing to the evolution of backend development practices within the team.




Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.




A bit about them?

A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.




The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.




With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.







Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.







3 stage Interview Process

Initial Chat
Technical Discussion
Final with CEO
Show more

Title: Frontend Developer
Description:
⚡️ What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

🌟Who We Are

Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.

At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.

To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Frontend Developer.

👩‍💻 About The Role

The Partner Platform serves as our interface with our partners, offering insights into their flexible energy assets and illustrating their contributions to the energy system. As an early member of this newly formed squad, you will play a pivotal role in shaping both the product and our team’s culture and ways of working. Your contributions will significantly impact how our partners perceive Flower and our services.

What You’ll Do


Learn about the green energy transition and get a deep understanding of Flower’s offering
Collaborate closely with the Product Designer, Product Owner, Full-stack developers and Data Engineer
Develop and maintain the frontend of our web portal built in React, NestJS etc
Realize new user flows and implement crisp designs from Figma
Contribute to stable and scalable solutions
Contribute in discussions about architecture, design and user needs
Visualize complex data, showcasing Flower’s flexibility services to our Partners
Work with new features connected to internationalization, diversification of our portfolio of assets (renewable energy production and storage) and new data streams


Who You Are


You find it meaningful to contribute to Flower’s mission
You have a degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent documented experience
You have at least four years of industry experience in web development
You have experience of building system from scratch or early on
You have strong frontend programming skills, specifically in React
You are familiar with backend frameworks such as Nest.js, Spring, or Django
You have experience building responsive web applications
You have excellent problem-solving skills and mindset
You have strong communication and collaboration abilities


📍 Location

Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from the old town and Slussen subway stations. We value office collaboration but support hybrid work.

✉️ Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Talent Acquisition Specialist, Developers from the team, Head of Partner Platform, and our CEO John.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.
Show more

Title: Development Engineer
Description:
DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER (Panthera)

Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.

At Permobil, the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.

Panthera is a division of Permobil that develops and manufactures innovative wheelchairs for people with disabilities. We are looking for a Development Engineer to join our team in Spånga (Stockholm), Sweden, and help us deliver our business plan and support our growth journey.

Are you a skilled and motivated mechanical engineer with a flair for creating innovative solutions? Do you have experience with Solidworks, CAD, and other engineering tools? If you answered yes to these questions, then you might be the perfect candidate for the Development Engineer position!

Key Tasks

You will design, develop, and construct products using Solidworks and other software. You will be responsible for the project's entire lifecycle, from conceptualisation to testing and implementation. You will also collaborate with other engineers, project managers, and clients to ensure the quality and functionality of the final product.

Also, You Will


Perform design work and develop prototypes in new product development and sustain of current assortment
Coordinate testing and testing of new products
Coordinate the start of production of new products
Participate and lead project work


Who You Are

You are passionate, innovative, and ambitious. You want to make a difference for others and feel fulfilled when you can see the link between the work you do and positive improvements in the lives of others. You search out opportunities and are prepared to go off the beaten track to chase your dreams.

Skills And Qualifications


A minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial or Mechanical Engineering
Proficiency in CAD, 3D modelling, and simulation tools
Knowledge of engineering principles, standards, and best practices
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills
You must have a basic knowledge level in Swedish and be fluent in English
Experience from Med-tech, at least 2 years experience from similar role and experience working with Solidworks is meritorious.


Why Permobil Is a Great Next Step For You


You’ll make a difference. Every day Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
You’ll make your mark as part of our future We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
You’ll feel welcome from day one We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone in the Permobil family cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.


More information

Please apply via our career page no later than October 30th. We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today!

For additional information about the position, please contact Jonas Persson, Technical Product Manager, jonas.persson@permobil.com

For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com

For information regarding Permobil's Privacy Notice, please visit privacy.permobil.com

At Permobil, diversity fuels our innovation in creating life-changing mobility solutions. We embrace the unique talents and perspectives of individuals from all backgrounds to drive our mission forward. Join Permobil and be part of a team where diversity is not just valued, but essential to our success in delivering personalized mobility solutions.

Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.

More About Permobil

Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.

Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 1900 team members in more than 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.
Show more

DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER (Panthera)

Would you like to work in an international environment where you’ll make a difference every day? At Permobil, we’re looking for game-changers to join us as we innovate for individuals and develop the world’s most advanced assistive solutions.

At Permobil, the people who use our products come first. Our purpose is to create advanced assistive solutions that make the lives of adults and children living with disabilities more enriching. Our people are passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology to deliver innovations that improve lives. We are a sustainable and responsible business committed to continuous improvement, and our customers can trust us to provide market-leading solutions driven by insights-based clinical data.

Panthera is a division of Permobil that develops and manufactures innovative wheelchairs for people with disabilities. We are looking for a Development Engineer to join our team in Spånga (Stockholm), Sweden, and help us deliver our business plan and support our growth journey.

Are you a skilled and motivated mechanical engineer with a flair for creating innovative solutions? Do you have experience with Solidworks, CAD, and other engineering tools? If you answered yes to these questions, then you might be the perfect candidate for the Development Engineer position!

Key Tasks

You will design, develop, and construct products using Solidworks and other software. You will be responsible for the project's entire lifecycle, from conceptualisation to testing and implementation. You will also collaborate with other engineers, project managers, and clients to ensure the quality and functionality of the final product.

Also, You Will

  • Perform design work and develop prototypes in new product development and sustain of current assortment
  • Coordinate testing and testing of new products
  • Coordinate the start of production of new products
  • Participate and lead project work

Who You Are

You are passionate, innovative, and ambitious. You want to make a difference for others and feel fulfilled when you can see the link between the work you do and positive improvements in the lives of others. You search out opportunities and are prepared to go off the beaten track to chase your dreams.

Skills And Qualifications

  • A minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial or Mechanical Engineering
  • Proficiency in CAD, 3D modelling, and simulation tools
  • Knowledge of engineering principles, standards, and best practices
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills
  • You must have a basic knowledge level in Swedish and be fluent in English
  • Experience from Med-tech, at least 2 years experience from similar role and experience working with Solidworks is meritorious.

Why Permobil Is a Great Next Step For You

  • You’ll make a difference. Every day Everything we do leads to understanding and improving the lives of our users. Through our evidence-based innovation, we make a difference to people’s lives.
  • You’ll make your mark as part of our future We collaborate with colleagues across borders to Innovate for Individuals. The impact you make personally could lead change around the world.
  • You’ll feel welcome from day one We’re known for being great colleagues, who are collaborative, fun and at the cutting-edge. Everyone in the Permobil family cares as much as you do about making a positive difference.

More information

Please apply via our career page no later than October 30th. We will conduct selection continuously so send us your application today!

For additional information about the position, please contact Jonas Persson, Technical Product Manager, jonas.persson@permobil.com

For information about the recruitment process, please contact Zivile Mitkute, Talent Acquisition Partner, zivile.mitkute@permobil.com

For information regarding Permobil's Privacy Notice, please visit privacy.permobil.com

At Permobil, diversity fuels our innovation in creating life-changing mobility solutions. We embrace the unique talents and perspectives of individuals from all backgrounds to drive our mission forward. Join Permobil and be part of a team where diversity is not just valued, but essential to our success in delivering personalized mobility solutions.

Please respect that we do not wish recruitment assistance or advertising, we decline calls from recruitment and advertising providers.

More About Permobil

Permobil founder Dr. Per Uddén believed that helping people achieve the greatest level of independence is a basic human right and, for over 50 years, Permobil has held fast to that belief. Permobil is a global leader in advanced rehabilitation technology, passionate about better understanding our users’ needs and improving their quality of life through state-of-the-art healthcare solutions. Today, those solutions include power wheelchairs, seating and positioning products, power assist, and manual wheelchairs.

Permobil is part of Patricia Industries, a subsidiary of Investor AB, and is headquartered in Sweden. Permobil has 1900 team members in more than 18 countries around the world. For more information regarding the company’s storied history and complete product line, visit permobil.com.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to help transform the legal industry? At Aloi, you'll be part of a dynamic, collaborative team that’s pushing boundaries and driving real change. This is your chance to redefine how legal services are delivered with cutting-edge AI solutions and make an impact that matters.




About Us:

Aloi is dedicated to revolutionizing the legal services industry with cutting-edge AI technology. By enhancing efficiency and accuracy in legal processes, we empower law firms to deliver superior commercial legal services. Our platform focuses on automating document creation, review, and analysis, streamlining legal research, and providing advanced tools for negotiation strategies.




The Role:

We’re looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join us as a foundational team member at Aloi. This is a critical role where you’ll work directly with our founders to establish the technical foundation for the company. You’ll play a key part in driving our technical vision and creating scalable solutions that address complex legal challenges.




Responsibilities:

Develop high-quality, robust, and scalable AI-driven applications from conception to deployment.
Rapidly prototype and iterate on innovative solutions to complex legal challenges.
Implement advanced AI models and algorithms tailored for the legal industry.
Ensure the reliability and performance of our AI systems through continuous testing and refinement.




Technical Background:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field. Exceptional candidates with proven track records are also welcome.
Proficiency in multiple programming languages (C/C++, Go, Rust, etc.) and familiarity with AI.
A proven track record of successful, innovative, and impactful software development projects.
Ability to contribute across the stack with a familiarity in both backend and frontend technologies.




Desirable Skills:

Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for AI services and data processing.
Contributions to open-source projects related to AI, machine learning, or innovative software solutions.
Experience with distributed computing for scaling AI solutions and managing large datasets.
Strong understanding of cybersecurity practices and data privacy regulations.
Familiarity with the legal industry and its unique challenges.
Located in Stockholm for effective collaboration.




Who You Are:

You possess strong communication skills and can articulate complex concepts and ideas clearly.
You are a problem solver who tackles difficult challenges independently and gets things done.
You have a curious mindset and embrace new technology to improve your output.
You prioritize your time effectively and focus on results rather than processes.
You strive to find the simplest solution to get things done.
You have a hacker’s mindset with the ability to adapt and innovate under rapidly changing conditions.
You are ego-less when searching for the best idea and can let go of your own when necessary.




What We Offer:

A dynamic, supportive, and fast-paced environment where your work directly impacts the future of AI-powered legal services.
Market-competitive salary with significant stock options, offering a stake in the company’s success.
Access to state-of-the-art resources and tools to bring your ideas to life.
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement in a rapidly growing industry.
A collaborative team of innovators dedicated to making a significant impact in the legal industry.




﻿Join Us:

If you’re ready to dive into the world of AI-driven legal services and be a foundational member of our team, apply now to become Aloi's Senior AI Engineer. Let’s redefine the future of legal technology together.




Apply now and be a crucial part of Aloi's journey!

Show more

Title: Dataanalytiker – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt företag inom rekrytering och bemanning. Besök oss på www.modernera.se.

För en av våra kunders räkning söker vi nu en Dataanalytiker. Vår kund är ett väletablerat konsultbolag med stark ekonomi. Företaget erbjuder intressanta uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, med fokus på samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar, samt en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal. Företaget har varit verksamt sedan 2003 och har idag cirka 100 medarbetare.

Du kommer att arbeta i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm, med alternativet att även jobba hemifrån.

I din roll som dataanalytiker kommer du att hjälpa företagets kunder att effektivisera och digitalisera sina verksamheter. Du kommer att rapportera, utveckla och följa upp nyckeltal samt ta fram relevanta åtgärder för att maximera värdet för kunderna. Du visualiserar och kommunicerar resultat för att bidra till nya insikter och ett mer datadrivet beslutsfattande.

Vi söker dig som:


har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
har upp till 5 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
har god förmåga att visualisera och kommunicera resultat
har erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
är van vid att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
har goda SQL-kunskaper


Meriterande:


har tidigare erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS,
har kunskap i R eller Python,
har erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS.
har kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg


Du får:


intressanta uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar
en anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och goda samarbeten
balans mellan arbete och fritid
en individuell kompetensutveckling som är unik för dig och din karriärbana
en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och attraktiva förmåner
en lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig kompensation och vinstdelning
en platt organisation med nära till ledningen och stor möjlighet till inflytande


Du kommer att bli anställd direkt hos vår kund, på heltid. Provanställningen övergår till en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Dataanalytiker – Stockholm heltid” i ämnesraden.

Title: System Test Engineer to Life-Science start-up
Description:
Here you have the opportunity to be a part of something special! Our partner has rapidly expanded its business, achieving remarkable success in the field of life sciences. They are developing a cutting-edge life science product that will revolutionize the industry. Now, they are seeking a System Test Engineer to join their dedicated team of experts. If you are passionate about pushing boundaries and working with groundbreaking technology in the research field, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.

Apply here!


City :

Solna


Job Category :

Technology


Extent :

Full time, on site


Start date :

As soon as possible


Type of work :

Staffing


About the role



Our partner continues their road to greatness and have quickly expanded their business to scale their success-story, developing a state-of-the-art life science product. You will be part of a hard-working organisation that every day gives their best to experiment and develop new-thinking technology within the research area. You will be instrumental in testing the new products and systems acting as the interface between the Software Team and the System Team.




Through your work you will be of an important role to the start-up. You work in a cross-functional position where your detail-oriented and systematic approach is of great value to future development of the products and the organisation.





You are offered







To be a part of a company with the ambition the achieve great success


Working closely with a senior colleagues with high level of competence


A dedicated partnership with your Consultant Manager



Work tasks




Defining and refining smoke tests of the software


Defining regression testing for new software releases


Writing test cases and test plans


Executing tests, reporting bugs and writing test reports



We are looking for




MSc Technical biology, Molecular Biotechnology, Engineering Physics, Mechanical engineering or similar


Work-life experience of system level testing, preferably of Life science instrumentation containing SW and HW


Product development experience, preferably within the Life science space


Experience from working hands on in labs or similar environment


Strong proficiency in English, both verbally and in writing






It is meritorious if you have







Previous experience of working system verification and validation


Worked with test creation and execution planning in Jira


Strong proficiency in Swedish, both verbally and in writing






To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:






We are looking for candidates that enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and in projects with multi-functional teams involved. The right candidate is detail-oriented and values a systematic and structured way of working.




It is important to have solid communication skills and a flexible mindset. To succeed in the role you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with and you enjoy working in a fast-paced and changing environment.



Our recruitment process




This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.




Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.


Become a part of Academic Work



When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.

Read more about Academic Work
Do you have questions about this job?



Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107146

Title: Data Scientist (Trust & Transparency)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

A core value proposition of Trustpilot is Trust. We work hard to ensure that our platform has genuine content from real people with real experiences. That means eliminating fake reviews and acting on signs of suspicious behavior to protect our platform from fraudulent activity. Our Trust Applied AI team’s mission is to use advanced modeling to safeguard the integrity of online reviews, and we have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust where Applied AI is integral to achieving our goals.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Trust team. You and your team will work to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative models at scale, alongside a cross-functional team of software developers, product managers, ML engineers, and designers. You will have the opportunity to collaborate widely across the business with our Technology and Product teams. You will also work closely with stakeholders in Legal and Platform Integrity.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying ML models. You need a strong technical foundation and hands-on experience in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. An adaptable mindset and understanding of the interface between Applied AI and engineering are essential as you will be working in cross-disciplinary teams. Experience with deploying solutions into production is expected, as you will be responsible for implementing end-to-end solutions—from data pre-processing to serving predictions.

What You Will Do


Be hands-on in delivering the Applied AI / Data Science component of key strategic projects in Trust, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modeling, anomaly detection, collaborative filtering, user segmentation, etc.
Develop, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers
Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and contribute to the Trust roadmap
Seize the chance to meaningfully influence our business through the latest advancements in Applied AI and keep Trustpilot on the edge of innovation when it comes to fake review detection
The opportunity to work with market-standard data engineering and deployment technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace


Who You Are


Experience with analysis and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. anomaly detection, sequence modeling, classification, and semi-supervised/active learning, as well as deep learning methods (e.g. for language problems and graphs)
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting
Experience in working with large datasets, ideally from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioral data, detecting misbehavior or fraud at scale is a big plus
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders
Proven 3+ years of technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy


What's In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

We offer flexibility and are offering these roles to work hybrid with a mixture of office and remote working, or if you are looking to be fully remote we are open to discussing this too! (As long as you are based in the UK or Denmark)

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.


Show more

You need a strong technical foundation and hands-on experience in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. An adaptable mindset and understanding of the interface between Applied AI and engineering are essential as you will be working in cross-disciplinary teams. Experience with deploying solutions into production is expected, as you will be responsible for implementing end-to-end solutions—from data pre-processing to serving predictions.

What You Will Do

  • Be hands-on in delivering the Applied AI / Data Science component of key strategic projects in Trust, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modeling, anomaly detection, collaborative filtering, user segmentation, etc.
  • Develop, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers
  • Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and contribute to the Trust roadmap
  • Seize the chance to meaningfully influence our business through the latest advancements in Applied AI and keep Trustpilot on the edge of innovation when it comes to fake review detection
  • The opportunity to work with market-standard data engineering and deployment technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment
  • Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace

Who You Are

  • Experience with analysis and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. anomaly detection, sequence modeling, classification, and semi-supervised/active learning, as well as deep learning methods (e.g. for language problems and graphs)
  • Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
  • Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting
  • Experience in working with large datasets, ideally from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioral data, detecting misbehavior or fraud at scale is a big plus
  • Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments
  • Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders
  • Proven 3+ years of technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy

What's In It For You

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

We offer flexibility and are offering these roles to work hybrid with a mixture of office and remote working, or if you are looking to be fully remote we are open to discussing this too! (As long as you are based in the UK or Denmark)

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Scientist - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 4 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with PST time zone

Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Must-Have


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming.
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.


Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 4 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
3+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
4+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Data Scientist - Go-to-Market (GTM) Applied AI team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

From reviews to user behaviors to internal systems, at Trustpilot, we truly have big data. Every month, more than half a million new reviews are posted on Trustpilot for thousands of businesses. We have now reached 267 million reviews - and that is growing! - from consumers around the world. Our Data Scientists in the GTM Applied AI team leverage this data to build AI/ML models that improve our go-to-market (GTM) efficiency and enhance our pricing and revenue management strategy.

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our GTM Applied AI team to develop, deploy, and maintain our GTM and Pricing models. You will collaborate closely with our pricing and monetization squad and team of software developers, data analytics and ML engineers to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative AI/ML models at scale. You will be part of a unique journey where data, AI, and ML are at the heart of our product and company strategy. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate broadly across the business, including with our Commercial, Digital Sales, and Applied AI teams, in both B2B and B2C contexts.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying AI/ML models to enhance commercial practices. You have a solid technical background, with hands-on ability in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. You must have an adaptable commercial mindset and knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. The ability to develop AI/ML solutions, engage stakeholders, and clearly articulate the impact of your work is necessary for this role. Experience putting solutions into production within an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you also have experience using AI and ML to solve pricing and revenue management problems.

What You’ll Be Doing


You will be involved in delivering some of our most exciting Data Science projects aimed at improving our GTM efficiency and pricing practices: from prediction to ranking, segmentation to NLP, and recommendation systems to content generation.
This is a great opportunity to make a real business impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
You will deliver the Data Science component of key strategic initiatives including owning, maintaining, and deploying production-ready ML/AI models, and analysing data to establish the scope and impact of your work.
You will identify new pricing and monetization opportunities based on data, interpreting model outcomes, and share insights to drive the direction of our business goals.
You will engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders & will translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace.


Who You Are


Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. Attribution, Segmentation, Churn, Upgrade, Upsell, and Pricing & Packaging.
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS will also be fine).
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting.
You have experience of working with large datasets. Knowledge of the data generated by websites or in the eCommerce sector, behavioral analytics, and experience working with data from commercial systems (e.g. Salesforce) is advantageous.
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience of cloud-based ML model deployments is beneficial.
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
Proven technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Skills: analytical skills,artificial intelligence,python,data science,data scientist,bug fixing,jupyter notebooks,data analytic,programming,documentation,analytical abilities,ai technology,data analyst,data analysis skills,communication,stakeholder management,written english communication,business sense,problem solving,python code,problem-solving skills,data,communication skills,bachelor’s/master’s degree in engineering,data analytics,computer science,conversational english communication,data analytic abilities,data analysis,written communication,engineering,problem-solving,python programming,communication abilities

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by productionizing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions?

If so, apply to become a data scientist in our Advanced Analytics & AI team and help build world class solutions, work with the latest technologies and enjoy a fun and learning-oriented environment.

Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead the global data science initiatives and capabilities across ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how ECCO operates based on data. This means working with the entire value chain – from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing and store operations.

As a Data Scientist, You Will Develop, Implement And Deliver Data Science Solutions, Ranging From Exploratory Analyses To Automated Solutions In Production. You Will Learn How We Work With DevOps And DataOps Pipelines, And You Will Be Part Of Deploying And Maintaining Solutions. Furthermore, You Will


Be part of a well-established Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely together with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Develop new and existing data science products, e.g. for price optimisation, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare and synthesise data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised and reinforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform that is delivered by a state-of-the-art Data Platform team


You enjoy learning while solving real problems

You Are Always Interested In Learning New Technologies And Ways Of Working. And If There’s Something You Don’t Know, We Are The Perfect Place To Learn It. We Imagine That You


Have (or will soon complete) a master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, physics or economics
Haven proven your ability to excel (e.g., excellent academic record, extra-curricular activities), however previous full-time work experience is not required
Know at least one programming language, ideally python
Are familiar with modern cloud-based data tech stacks; although this is a plus, not a requirement, if you don’t we will teach you!
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus.


We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with 30+ highly skilled, motivated, collaborative and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.

We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this development.

Are you ready for your next challenge?

We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply. For additional information, you can reach out to Head of Advanced Analytics & AI, Thomas Jauho THJAU@ecco.com.

Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on https://enter.ecco.com.

CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.

Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?




AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

—




Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modeling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, etc.




AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 80+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach and effect of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach and impact their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the world’s biggest brands.




What you will do




You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with seven other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Tech department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.

Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education, preferably from a social science background specializing in statistics and data analysis or a numerically oriented education.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create business insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, including various regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and machine learning models.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analyzing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioral data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages customers.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer




A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.




Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application




If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




If you have any questions about the position, please contact Jacob Daniel Kirstejn Hansen at jacobh@audienceproject.com.




We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so please don’t hesitate to send your application. Apply by filling out the application form: https://share.hsforms.com/15Mw2OSWQQo-N78GVJfcsNw21v9v.




The deadline for applications is October 20th, 2024. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.




We look forward to receiving your application!

Show more
