Title: Internship: Data Scientist
Description:
Internship:
Data Scientist

Dreaming of working with high-quality software that makes a real difference? Then seize this opportunity and apply for an internship as a Data Scientist at Systematic!

More than just an internship
As a Data Scientist intern, you will join our SitaWare Insight team which is part of our Defence business unit. SitaWare Insight is a decision-support tool that transforms data collection and management, providing commanders at various levels with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities. The mission for the program is to simplify critical decision-making. Modern technologies like AI are used to transform data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities.

As an intern, you will play a vital role in the team, contribute to the advancement of modern technologies and be treated on a par with the other employees. Moreover, you will become an integrated part of a team from day one, receiving the professional sparring and feedback you need to succeed.

Freedom With Responsibilities
Our new intern will get to make a real difference working with high-quality software, while you will have every opportunity to apply what you have learnt so far on your study programme. In addition, some of your daily tasks include contributing to daily advancements and developing and documenting code according to agile principles while using Python and other relevant technologies.

In so far as possible, you will be able to plan your own tasks as we strive to create the right balance between your personal wishes, your formal study requirements and our expectations.

You are our new intern
… if you are studying for a BSc or MSc in Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Engineering or similar. And if you work systematically, are motivated by the quality of your work and always maintain a focus on the details.

Throughout your internship, the focus will be on developing your competencies, which we envisage are as follows:


You take an interest in, are knowledgeable about or have experience with LLMs and natural language processing methods.
You possess experience at developing or implementing machine learning models.
You are proficient with Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers or TensorFlow.
You are proficient in data preprocessing and feature engineering.
You understand data handling, model evaluation, the visualisation of data-driven solutions and the development of best practices.
You speak and write English fluently as it is our corporate language. It is also an advantage if you can speak Danish, but this is not a requirement. 



Practical information  

The internship lasts five months, starting 3 February 2025. 
The internship is a full-time position.
When applying, please include your CV as well as your exam certificates. 
We will be assessing job applications as we receive them, as we are keen to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!  



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.  

  

Never stop developing   

Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.   

 

In addition to your team, you will become part of an Intern network with other Interns at Systematic, providing you with a rich opportunity to network across the organisation. You can also look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 social/professional events a year. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!  

  

Start your development here  

We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Helene Overgaard Bach, Junior Consultant, People Attraction.

Get in touch

Helene Overgaard Bach

Junior Consultant
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for Artificial Intelligence og Machine Learning, og har du lyst til at forbedre kundeoplevelsen og interne processer gennem avancerede datamodeller?




”Hej, jeg hedder Henri, og jeg er leder for afdelingen Data & Insights, hvor vi arbejder med data for at skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger på tværs af Magasin. Vi er på udkig efter en AI Specialist, der til en start skal hjælpe os med at berige vores produktdata gennem udvikling af ML modeller, herunder brug af både LLM’er og Computer Vision for at sikre høj kvalitet, konsistens og brugerværdi i produktattributter, hvilket forbedrer kundeoplevelsen.”




Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med et stærkt team bestående af BI-specialister, dataingeniører, webanalytikere og indsigtsspecialister for at sikre, at vi udnytter AI og ML til fulde i vores data- og forretningsstrategi.







Din hverdag i Magasin

I Magasin kan du se frem til en dynamisk hverdag, med fart over feltet. Som AI Specialist hos os vil dine primære arbejdsopgaver være:

Udvikling, træning og implementering af machine learning-modeller, der beriger produktdata, forbedrer datakvaliteten og sikrer konsistens i produktattributter
Anvendelse af LLM’er og Computer Vision-modeller til at øge produktattributters brugerværdi og præcision
Samarbejde med forretningsenheder for at identificere potentielle AI-løsninger, der kan forbedre kundeoplevelsen og optimere data
Sikre at AI-modeller integreres i vores eksisterende datastrukturer og understøtter vores overordnede forretningsstrategi
Løbende evaluering og optimering af modeller for at sikre performance og relevans
Udnyttelse af vores Azure-infrastruktur til udvikling og skalering af AI-løsninger







Du er vigtig for os

.. fordi du med din viden er med til at udvikle og implementere skræddersyede løsninger, som optimerer vores produktdata og driver vores forretningsmæssige succes som en af Danmarks førende retailere. Vi leder efter dig, der har:

Erfaring med at udvikle og implementere ML-modeller, herunder LLM’er og Computer Vision
Stærk viden om Python eller lignende programmeringssprog anvendt til AI-udvikling
Erfaring med cloud-platforme, særligt Microsoft Azure, og evnen til at udnytte platformens muligheder for AI og ML
Interesse for at forstå komplekse forretningsbehov og omdanne dem til tekniske løsninger
Erfaring med at arbejde med store datamængder og sikre datakvalitet gennem automatiserede processer
Evnen til at samarbejde på tværs af forskellige teams og drive projekter fremad







Mig som leder

Jeg lægger stor vægt på samarbejde og fælles ansvar. Jeg forventer, at du engagerer dig fuldt ud i at skabe løsninger, der gør en forskel for vores kunder. Du vil have rig mulighed for at eksperimentere og anvende dine færdigheder inden for AI i tæt dialog med resten af teamet, men det er også dit ansvar at sikre, at vi løbende når vores mål.




Vi ser frem til at byde en ny AI Specialist velkommen til vores team, og jeg glæder mig til at læse din ansøgning.




De bedste hilsner,




Henri Legentil-Borup

Head of Data & Insights







Vil du søge jobbet?

Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, og går du videre i processen, skal du igennem flere steps, hvor både du og vi vurderer, om denne stilling er det rigtige match for dig og Magasin. Hos os kan du blive inviteret til videointerview, samtaler med både HR, leder og ansættende direktør i et forløb på 1-2 måneder. Som en del af processen bruger vi personprofiler, problemløsningstest og faglige cases alt sammen for at sikre det optimale match for begge parter. Vi ser frem til i sidste ende at byde den helt rette kandidat velkommen i magiske Magasin.

Show more

  • Erfaring med cloud-platforme, særligt Microsoft Azure, og evnen til at udnytte platformens muligheder for AI og ML
  • Interesse for at forstå komplekse forretningsbehov og omdanne dem til tekniske løsninger
  • Erfaring med at arbejde med store datamængder og sikre datakvalitet gennem automatiserede processer
  • Evnen til at samarbejde på tværs af forskellige teams og drive projekter fremad



Mig som leder

Jeg lægger stor vægt på samarbejde og fælles ansvar. Jeg forventer, at du engagerer dig fuldt ud i at skabe løsninger, der gør en forskel for vores kunder. Du vil have rig mulighed for at eksperimentere og anvende dine færdigheder inden for AI i tæt dialog med resten af teamet, men det er også dit ansvar at sikre, at vi løbende når vores mål.


Vi ser frem til at byde en ny AI Specialist velkommen til vores team, og jeg glæder mig til at læse din ansøgning.


De bedste hilsner,


Henri Legentil-Borup

Head of Data & Insights



Vil du søge jobbet?

Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, og går du videre i processen, skal du igennem flere steps, hvor både du og vi vurderer, om denne stilling er det rigtige match for dig og Magasin. Hos os kan du blive inviteret til videointerview, samtaler med både HR, leder og ansættende direktør i et forløb på 1-2 måneder. Som en del af processen bruger vi personprofiler, problemløsningstest og faglige cases alt sammen for at sikre det optimale match for begge parter. Vi ser frem til i sidste ende at byde den helt rette kandidat velkommen i magiske Magasin.

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With our product, Pleo is challenging outdated norms in the business spend industry by trusting employees to make purchases on the company's behalf -- no more expense reports or out of pocket spending. This puts trust in employees so that they can buy what they need when they need it. Future of work stuff, you know?

But let us introduce you to the domain this role will be part of:

The Spend Management helps our customers manage their spend with us in a way that's intuitive, efficient, and user-friendly. Humans interacting with our product should feel valued, delighted and impactful in whatever they are trying to do. This will be a fixed term contract of 12 months. However, we have a very good internal mobility program that means that the chances of finding a new position for another team after the 12 months pass are very high.

So What's Data & Analytics At Pleo Like?


At Pleo, our 40+ talented Data & Analytics professionals are on a mission to demystify data and drive company growth. 🔓 We're all about owning insights and fostering a culture of data literacy, shaping Pleo’s data strategy to empower stakeholders across the board
We're a diverse team of data & analytics engineers, analysts, and scientists, utilizing cutting-edge tools like Looker, BigQuery, dbt, and more
Our work spans the breadth of Pleo's operations, from platform intricacies to CRM data, financial records, and beyond

What Great Looks Like In This Role


Be part of the team that provides company-wide trusted insights on our products and features, focusing on predictive and prescriptive insights
Pave the way for Data Science at Pleo; establish methodologies for building machine learning (ML) models that help us deliver exceptional experiences to our customers and drive our revenue and user growth
You autonomously tackle complex problems with a solution-driven and pragmatic approach
You translate business problems into technical challenges, and take ownership in designing and executing the solutions
You effectively collaborate with product & engineering teams, and enable these stakeholders to develop data-inspired products and solutions
Demonstrate innovative thinking by exploring diverse data sources (internal and external) to improve the predictive power of your models
You are an ambassador for excellence within the Data & Analytics community, you lead by example, share your knowledge, and inspire others


Your Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including product managers and business leaders, to understand their objectives and requirements. Lead the scoping, design, and development phases to create tailored, data-inspired solutions
Conduct quantitative research to inform product strategy and identify opportunities for improvement. Devise learning methods, including experiments, to test hypotheses and enhance our understanding of user behavior
Understand, identify, and leverage data sources across Pleo, encompassing both internal data and external data that can be utilized for building models
Monitor and optimize the performance of ML models, focusing on a long-term strategy to continuously improve user experiences
Translate complex data into actionable insights and effectively communicate technical work and findings to diverse audiences, ranging from product managers to leadership teams
Provide mentorship and guidance to other data & analytics team members, fostering a collaborative and learning-oriented environment within the data & analytics team
Stay abreast of advancements in ML and artificial intelligence, exploring opportunities to implement cutting-edge technologies in product development


Your Colleagues Say You:


Are self-sufficient, solution-driven, and love to see the impact of your work and team
Have excellent hands-on knowledge of SQL + Python/R and experience with more advanced analytics topics such as cohort and regression analysis
Expertise in applying data science within product teams to optimize features and user experiences. Demonstrate a track record of designing automated solutions with ML, particularly in the context of in-product decisions that align with business goals, ideally within the financial services industry
You have experience and comprehensive knowledge in machine learning (ML), covering a range of algorithms and techniques, including but not limited to the selection of appropriate models, tuning of hyperparameters, and rigorous evaluation of model performance. Are familiar with at least one cloud platform (GCP/AWS/Azure) and acquainted with ML Ops practices
Take proactive ownership, exhibit adaptability in problem-solving, and demonstrate authentic leadership with a commitment to radical candour


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist in Group Risk Analytics (Maternity Cover)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you excited for data and data science? Do you take pride in your data assets and the data-driven decisions and insights they generate? Then come join our team of Data Scientists in Danske Bank!

Our team of 40+ that works with other teams across the bank to understand the bank’s data value chain. To support our unique functions and regulatory needs, our team stores, curates, and exposes big data. This enables us to master the end-to-end journey of our big data, as well as our modelling and analytic products. As a Data Scientist, you will be working on the top-priority project, which introduces a remediation approach related to the Bank’s debt collection and hence has a massive impact on Danske’s risk management.

You will be joining an international team located between Copenhagen and Vilnius. Therefore, solid English skills are a necessity for this role.

Don’t you meet every single requirement? At Danske Bank, we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace and a healthy environment to develop in, so if you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Join a vibrant team at Danske Bank's. You will experience a culture that embraces Danske Bank's Culture Commitments: Be Open, Team Up, and Own It. Additionally, you will enjoy an attractive salary package, flexible work arrangements, and extensive professional development opportunities.

Please note that this is a fixed-term contract for maternity cover. Danske Bank supports a high degree of workplace flexibility (our team is currently using a hybrid working model, where we work at least 3 days a week in the office.).

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:


Work with data analysis and development of deterministic models for our debt collection remediation solutions
Integrate, explore, and aggregate the data. This includes data cleaning, data massage, error removal, and schema change
Attend and contribute to strategy alignment meetings across different teams
Dive deep into complex data issues using SQL and Python, performing investigative and risk analysis
Utilize git for version control to systematically develop, update, and maintain data models
Create detailed documentation and develop presentations to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively. Your ability to articulate complex data insights verbally, in writing, and visually should be advanced


About you:


Higher education within mathematics, computer science, engineering, statistics, physics, or similar
3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics or engineering field
Experience in handling large amounts of data and fluency in Python, R, SQL, PySpark, etc.
Have an analytical mindset and a fact-based approach
Hands-on with git and coding best practices
A curious individual with great problem-solving skills and the ability to keep result-oriented holistic view
Upper-Intermediate English skills


We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me – Loreta Dailidonė via email lord@danskebank.lt, and I will answer your questions!

Loreta Dailidonė

lord@danskebank.lt

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.
Show more

Please note that this is a fixed-term contract for maternity cover. Danske Bank supports a high degree of workplace flexibility (our team is currently using a hybrid working model, where we work at least 3 days a week in the office.).

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:

  • Work with data analysis and development of deterministic models for our debt collection remediation solutions
  • Integrate, explore, and aggregate the data. This includes data cleaning, data massage, error removal, and schema change
  • Attend and contribute to strategy alignment meetings across different teams
  • Dive deep into complex data issues using SQL and Python, performing investigative and risk analysis
  • Utilize git for version control to systematically develop, update, and maintain data models
  • Create detailed documentation and develop presentations to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively. Your ability to articulate complex data insights verbally, in writing, and visually should be advanced

About you:

  • Higher education within mathematics, computer science, engineering, statistics, physics, or similar
  • 3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics or engineering field
  • Experience in handling large amounts of data and fluency in Python, R, SQL, PySpark, etc.
  • Have an analytical mindset and a fact-based approach
  • Hands-on with git and coding best practices
  • A curious individual with great problem-solving skills and the ability to keep result-oriented holistic view
  • Upper-Intermediate English skills

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me – Loreta Dailidonė via email lord@danskebank.lt, and I will answer your questions!

Loreta Dailidonė

lord@danskebank.lt

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player for the success of our cutting-edge AI healthcare products.

Are you a passionate data scientist with a desire to make an impact in the healthcare sector? Systematic Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Scientist to develop cutting-edge AI for our healthcare products. As a Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge AI and machine learning models, ensuring seamless integration with our healthcare products. Join us and become part of a dynamic team that simplifies critical decision-making for healthcare professionals worldwide.

About Our Team
At Systematic, we foster a supportive and collaborative work environment where your contributions are valued and encouraged. We believe in nurturing talent and providing ample opportunities for career growth. You will be working close together with other data scientists and architects. The team is based on informal communication and mutual trust in each other’s expertise.

Build AI solutions for Systematic Healthcare
In Systematic, our mission is to have a positive impact on the world stage by supporting our customers in critical decision making in critical environments. We are looking for new team members that can help contribute to our mission. Here, you will come across exciting challenges that are unique to our domain.

You will be part of shaping the future of our AI innovation and development of healthcare products in this hands-on Data Scientist role. You will contribute as a key player to innovation around ML/AI for our healthcare products, introducing novel capabilities and overall product enhancements.

Key responsibilities:


Work with a variety of machine learning tasks such as natural language processing, speech recognition, anomaly detection and more
Be involved in all phases of the data science workflow including clarification, experimentation, modelling, testing, communicating, and deploying data driven solutions
Collaborate with product managers, product owners and domain experts
Participate in technical sparring sessions and code inspections
Think innovatively by coming up with ideas and improvements



About You
To thrive in this role, you should bring a few years of experience and curiosity to the table.

We are looking for candidates who possesses the following qualifications:


Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks model development (e.g. PyTorch and Tensorflow)
Experience with LLM and prompting
Solid understanding of model evaluation, documentation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development best-practices
Experience with Docker and FastAPI
Appreciate teamwork and sparring
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club offering almost 100 social/professional events a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves a variety of delicious and healthy dishes each day. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Jacob Elgaard Manager.

Get in touch

Sofie Heiner Emborg

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Platform Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Our Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading

Platform Engineer (Python) in Copenhagen




We’re expanding our Tech Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading. We are seeking platform engineers with a software development background, preferably in Python, and with experience in making critical technological choices, designing, and implementing data stores and pipelines, and producing high-quality software with a keen focus on delivering value.




If your skills and interests align with this opportunity, and you're excited about working for a company dedicated to the energy transition, consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Copenhagen Energy Trading.




As a young and rapidly expanding energy trading firm, we welcome candidates with varying levels of experience. So don’t hesitate to apply if you only have a few years under your belt.




About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you’ll be joining our Tech Team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the critical infrastructure and platform services powering our analytics and many of our business functions.




You will get to develop resilient front-end and back-end applications, understand and codify complex business logic, automate tests, define infrastructure-as-code and workflow deployments declaratively - and much more, but everything as code. We are a bunch of Pythonistas, but we're also flexible and open towards other languages, if needed.




What is especially intriguing about this role is the direct impact your contributions can have on the improvement of our trading operations. You will be seated close to your trading colleagues, which makes it easy to collaborate and share new ideas on how we can make our solutions even better.




The position will be based at our headquarters located in the district of Carlsberg City in Central Copenhagen.




Responsibilities

Software: Design and implement scalable, reliable, and efficient software solutions, including data pipelines for ingesting and transforming data. Help set and follow software best practices to influence the way we build, document, review and test our software. You must be a fighter of technical debt in code bases.
Infrastructure & Cloud: Work on enhancing our platform infrastructure spanning the entire data lifecycle from ingestion and data transformation to machine-learning model management and reporting. We are cloud-native and run on Azure. You and the team are responsible for developing and securing our cloud infrastructure.
Automation & DevOps: Automate processes and optimize DevOps practices to streamline development and deployment environments.
Security and Compliance: Ensure security, performance, and compliance standards in everything we do.
Containerization: Leverage containerization for deploying our applications, while ensuring the reliability and security of the containerized applications throughout their lifecycle.
Analysis: Conduct various ad hoc analyses to assist in decision-making processes. Often, this will involve running proof-of-concept experiments on new technologies and tools to enhance the platform’s capabilities.
Support: Participate in on-call rotations for platform support and maintenance, assisting in troubleshooting platform-related issues, and occasionally addressing other technology-related concerns within the company.




Qualifications and Experience

Education: A master’s or bachelor’s degree with a strong technological basis, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other relevant fields.
Software Development Experience: Proven proficiency in crafting Python software solutions that are not only functional but also production ready. Ideally, your experience should encompass managing challenges related to scalability, performance, and reliability.
Python Proficiency: A strong command of Python programming language is a must. If Event loops, context managers, type-hints and generators are all parts of your vocabulary, then that is awesome.
DevOps and Deployment: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes) is advantageous. You should be comfortable deploying applications to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. Big plus, if you have experience in achieving parity between production, staging and dev.
Database Skills: Some experience with database design, development, and optimization, preferably with PostgreSQL would be great.
Communication Skills: Excellent problem-solving and communication skills with full professional proficiency in English.
Electricity markets: A genuine interest in learning about electricity markets.
Technology-enthusiast: A strong enthusiasm for staying up to date with emerging technologies is like icing on the cake.




What We Offer

At Copenhagen Energy, we're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where your talents and contributions are recognized and valued. When you join our team, you'll benefit from:

Exceptional Team: Join a team of professional and highly ambitious colleagues who continuously set the bar high, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the energy trading market. We do not use either SAFe or Scrum but follow a Kanban-style iterative approach towards agility. We fight technical debt and muda, mura and muri in every process.
Thrilling growth environment: Be a part of a young and rapidly growing company with an authentic start-up atmosphere. Here, your innovative ideas will be celebrated, and your contributions will be recognized.
Impact: Be part of a visionary organization driving positive change in the energy sector, and impact how we become more technology driven as an organization.
Attractive compensation: Receive a competitive salary package with benefits.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We value work-life balance and offer the freedom to work from the comfort of your own home.
Social and Professional Events: Enjoy a well-rounded work experience with various social and professional events, including sports activities and parties, fostering a strong team spirit and camaraderie.




About Us

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.




We specialize in short-term proprietary wholesale power trading in Europe. We work with modern technologies, and we have the best people working with us. Data and advanced analytics fuel our deep insights into the electricity markets and enable us to develop discretionary as well as system-based trading strategies that move power to where it is needed the most.




Since we believe in a culture of collaborative growth, we do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.




Next steps

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. For more information you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen jcj@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Data Scientist med fokus på infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you speak data? No, I speak Python.




Perfekt. Så er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne låne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal være vores nye Data Scientist hos Danske Spil.




”Vi vælger at gå på arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambitiøse og fokuserede, men vi har også masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige data engineers sørger for al data tilrettelæggelse, så vi i Data Science kan fokusere på de reelle data science opgaver og skabe værdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi målrettet på at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team bestående af fire data scientists, en tech lead samt en product owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere state-of-the-art machine learning løsninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadfærd og relevant kundedialog i vores produkt- og marketingafdelinger. Vi har et unikt datasæt både i omfang og kvalitet, og vi brænder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver

Vi søger en erfaren og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der kan tage ansvar for vores infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at arbejde sammen med dygtige kollegaer og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og lære fra dig. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det er selvfølgelig en fordel, hvis du har hørt om Danske Spil.




Din profil:

Du har en stærk baggrund inden for data science og modellering.
Du ”taler” flydende Python.
Du har gode samarbejdsevner, en god portion nysgerrighed og erfaring med at arbejde i scrum setup.
Du har nogle års erfaring på arbejdsmarkedet indenfor Data Science.
Du har erfaring med machine learning i et cloud setup – gerne i Azure og/eller Databricks.
Du er stærk til MLOps – især CI/CD machine learning pipelines og container løsninger.
Du er en profil der ønsker at drive leverancer.




Dine opgaver:

Indgå i teamets arbejde med udvikling, drift og eventuelle bugs på vores prædiktive og generative modeller.
Ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores data science infrastruktur.
Udvikling og implementering af nye modeller og algoritmer.
Analyse af komplekse datasæt og præsentation af resultater til ledelsen.
Indgå i dialog med både forretningen og tekniske medarbejdere om relevant data til specifikke problemer.
Kommunikere modellernes performance og bagvedliggende metode bredt i organisationen.
Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ”Fail fast”-mindset.
Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.




Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem og indkalder til samtaler løbende, men deadline for at søge er til og med den 20. oktober. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Majbritt Storm Lindegaard på masb@danskespil.dk.




Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine

Show more
HTML:
Do you speak data? No, I speak Python.


Perfekt. Så er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne låne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal være vores nye Data Scientist hos Danske Spil.


”Vi vælger at gå på arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambitiøse og fokuserede, men vi har også masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige data engineers sørger for al data tilrettelæggelse, så vi i Data Science kan fokusere på de reelle data science opgaver og skabe værdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.” – Trine Brandt, Leder af Data Science


Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi målrettet på at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team bestående af fire data scientists, en tech lead samt en product owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere state-of-the-art machine learning løsninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadfærd og relevant kundedialog i vores produkt- og marketingafdelinger. Vi har et unikt datasæt både i omfang og kvalitet, og vi brænder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.


Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver

Vi søger en erfaren og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der kan tage ansvar for vores infrastruktur og udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at arbejde sammen med dygtige kollegaer og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og lære fra dig. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det er selvfølgelig en fordel, hvis du har hørt om Danske Spil.


Din profil:

  • Du har en stærk baggrund inden for data science og modellering.
  • Du ”taler” flydende Python.
  • Du har gode samarbejdsevner, en god portion nysgerrighed og erfaring med at arbejde i scrum setup.
  • Du har nogle års erfaring på arbejdsmarkedet indenfor Data Science.
  • Du har erfaring med machine learning i et cloud setup – gerne i Azure og/eller Databricks.
  • Du er stærk til MLOps – især CI/CD machine learning pipelines og container løsninger.
  • Du er en profil der ønsker at drive leverancer.


Dine opgaver:

  • Indgå i teamets arbejde med udvikling, drift og eventuelle bugs på vores prædiktive og generative modeller.
  • Ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores data science infrastruktur.
  • Udvikling og implementering af nye modeller og algoritmer.
  • Analyse af komplekse datasæt og præsentation af resultater til ledelsen.
  • Indgå i dialog med både forretningen og tekniske medarbejdere om relevant data til specifikke problemer.
  • Kommunikere modellernes performance og bagvedliggende metode bredt i organisationen.
  • Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ”Fail fast”-mindset.
  • Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.


Vil du være med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi læser ansøgninger igennem og indkalder til samtaler løbende, men deadline for at søge er til og med den 20. oktober. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt på tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har spørgsmål til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Majbritt Storm Lindegaard på masb@danskespil.dk.


Vi glæder os til at møde dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Philip, Hakan, Marie Louise, Jakob, Pia, Tryggvi og Trine

Title: Data Science konsulent
Description:
Er du ekspert inden for Data Science - eller drømmer du om at blive det?




I Dataminds samarbejder vi med spændende danske og internationale virksomheder. Vi hjælper med at give bedre overblik, skabe dybere indsigt og styrke grundlag for kvalificeret beslutningstagning, altid med data som vores fundament. Vores konsulentydelser spænder over discipliner inden for Business Intelligence og Data Science.




Vi oplever betydelig vækst i vores forretning og en stigende efterspørgsel efter vores ydelser. Derfor søger vi dygtige kolleger til at være en del af den fortsatte udvikling af Dataminds.




Vores kontor ligger i Aarhus. Her gør vi os umage med at skabe et socialt og givende læringsmiljø, hvor kolleger betragter hinanden som godt selskab og stærke fagfolk. Der gives plads til, at alle kan tage ansvar og udvikle den faglige platform via projektarbejde, brancheindsigt, best practice værktøjer og kundedialoger. Vi tror på, at vi har rammerne og forudsætningen for at kunne udvikle de bedste Data Science eksperter i Danmark.




Du vil indgå i et dynamisk team af analytikere og konsulenter, hvis rolle er at løse forretningsmæssige problemstillinger med en stærk datadrevet tilgang. Vi forestiller os, at du er uddannet cand.merc, cand.oecon eller lignende. Du har et nysgerrigt og positivt drive og prioriterer at holde dig opdateret med udviklingen inden for Data Science og Business Intelligence. Vi søger både specialister og alsidige generalister. Praktisk erfaring fra tidligere jobs, relevante kurser eller lignende er en fordel, men ikke et krav.




Vi tilbyder




Et job med afvekslende opgaver og mulighed for faglig og personlig udvikling
En virksomhed der vokser kraftigt igennem samarbejdet med vores dygtige kunder
Et fællesskab, hvor vi altid stræber efter at overgå kundens høje forventninger
Muligheden for en god balance mellem job og fritid
Et socialt arbejdsmiljø med plads til et godt grin, en omgang padel, en løbetur eller en fredagsøl




Som vores nye Data Science Konsulent er det en fordel, hvis du




Er optaget af at forstå den forretningsmæssige udfordring, som vi skal hjælpe kunden med
Tager ansvar ift. at levere god kvalitet hhv. overholde aftaler
Bidrager til fællesskabet - socialt og fagligt
Arbejder struktureret og systematisk
Har erfaring med sprog som Python og R, samt værktøjer som Fabric, Data Factory, SQL, Power BI og Excel
Har lyst til at udvikle dig fagligt, og er nysgerrig ift. nye teknologier og metoder




Send os en ansøgning vedlagt dit CV og fortæl, hvad du kan tilføre Dataminds. 




Skriv til kpk@dataminds.com eller ring til Kasper Pilman Kristensen på mobil +45 2212 1269 for en uforpligtende - og fortrolig - samtale.




Arbejdspladsen er beliggende i Frichsparken, Søren Frichs Vej 38A, 8230 Åbyhøj, med arbejdstider inden for normal kontortid.




Ansøgninger behandles løbende. Sidste frist er 1. november 2024.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig.

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.


Skills: python,full stack development,aws/gcp,html,javascript/typescript,gcp,nestjs,nest.js,angular,aws,javascript,react,sql,css,typescript

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

Title: Analytical research scientist with data-driven mindset
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark : Hoersholm

Country: Denmark

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist!

We are looking for an analytical scientist with high interest in data science and chemical analysis.

At Novonesis, you contribute every single day to a more sustainable future based on biological solutions. Novonesis develops and produces, among other things, bacterial cultures for yogurt and cheese, probiotics for food supplements, and new microbiological solutions to extend the shelf life of products. Explorative Biochemical Analytics is part of the R&D organization in Novonesis. Our analysis work is carried out in collaboration with various business areas such as Enzymes, Dairy, Cheese, Plantbased dairy alternatives, Bioprotection, Human, Animal and Plant Health.

Welcome to Explorative Biochemical Analytics

Explorative Biochemical Analytics develops biochemical methods of analysis and provides qualitative and quantitative data of small molecules, peptides, proteins and polysaccharides in biological matrices for use in projects and product development. We primarily use liquid chromatography as separation technique and mass spectrometry, UV, infrared spectroscopy, and light scattering for detection. We are active in many projects to accelerate mode of action understanding and to improve the chemical characterization of existing and future enzymatic and microbial products.

Explorative Biochemical Analytics is a multinational department where we emphasize good collaboration, room for all of us, and where we help each other. We value the good communication between researchers, laboratory technicians and students. We work closely together to solve our tasks.

In this role you will make a difference by;

As our new research scientist your daily work will be a combination of optimizing digital workflows, supporting our local data capture systems and hands-on-work in the analytical laboratory analyzing samples, troubleshooting, build new methods, data analysis, visualization of the results and project interaction.

Your role will be dual and you will work with data science by programming and optimization of our digital data workflows as well as working in the laboratory with analytical chemistry and biochemistry. We expect you to work in close collaboration with our sister department, Core Biochemical Analytics, especially on the data science part.

Your Tasks Will Include


Maintenance and optimization of LIMS and digital workflows
Sample analysis and method development with qualitative and quantitative methods by FT-IR. Potentially also microfluidic capillary electrophoresis (LabChip) or high resolution-MS-MALDI to support new product development
Optimize sample extraction procedures for various complex matrices such as dairy and bacterial fermentations
Use advanced data analytical tools to extract information from the data generated to visualize and communicate results
Coordinate with internal stakeholders and other departments. Communicate the results generated within different projects to ensure aligned interpretation of results and best experimental praxis


To succeed in this position, you must hold;

Preferably you hold a PhD or have similar experiences and have worked a few years with analytical chemistry or biochemistry. Natural flair and interest in data handling is a must. Experience with macromolecule chemistry such as proteins and carbohydrates together with hands-on instrument troubleshooting and method development is an advantage.

You are a superior team player, good at communicating with colleagues in the laboratory as well as with collaborators outside the team. You are fluent in both spoken and written English, you have a flexible mindset, and thrive with changing tasks and expertise areas.

Further, You Preferably Have


2 to 5 years work experience
Practical experience using Python, R, SASJMP, Sample Manager and/or Benchling
Hands-on experience using FT-IR and multivariate analysis
Hand-on experience with one or more of following technologies; LabChip, HR-MS-MALDI, AF4-MALS, LC, GC, IC and MS systems
Experience in sample purification of small molecules or macromolecules from complex matrices


We do not expect you to have all of the above-mentioned skills, but we look forward to hearing from you if you have experience with some of these.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: November 1st, 2024. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Head of Explorative Biochemical Analytics Mette Kristensen at dkmetk@chr-hansen.com or +45 2240 7187.

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Show more
HTML:
Location: Denmark : Hoersholm

Country: Denmark

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist!

We are looking for an analytical scientist with high interest in data science and chemical analysis.

At Novonesis, you contribute every single day to a more sustainable future based on biological solutions. Novonesis develops and produces, among other things, bacterial cultures for yogurt and cheese, probiotics for food supplements, and new microbiological solutions to extend the shelf life of products. Explorative Biochemical Analytics is part of the R&D organization in Novonesis. Our analysis work is carried out in collaboration with various business areas such as Enzymes, Dairy, Cheese, Plantbased dairy alternatives, Bioprotection, Human, Animal and Plant Health.

Welcome to Explorative Biochemical Analytics

Explorative Biochemical Analytics develops biochemical methods of analysis and provides qualitative and quantitative data of small molecules, peptides, proteins and polysaccharides in biological matrices for use in projects and product development. We primarily use liquid chromatography as separation technique and mass spectrometry, UV, infrared spectroscopy, and light scattering for detection. We are active in many projects to accelerate mode of action understanding and to improve the chemical characterization of existing and future enzymatic and microbial products.

Explorative Biochemical Analytics is a multinational department where we emphasize good collaboration, room for all of us, and where we help each other. We value the good communication between researchers, laboratory technicians and students. We work closely together to solve our tasks.

In this role you will make a difference by;

As our new research scientist your daily work will be a combination of optimizing digital workflows, supporting our local data capture systems and hands-on-work in the analytical laboratory analyzing samples, troubleshooting, build new methods, data analysis, visualization of the results and project interaction.

Your role will be dual and you will work with data science by programming and optimization of our digital data workflows as well as working in the laboratory with analytical chemistry and biochemistry. We expect you to work in close collaboration with our sister department, Core Biochemical Analytics, especially on the data science part.

Your Tasks Will Include

  • Maintenance and optimization of LIMS and digital workflows
  • Sample analysis and method development with qualitative and quantitative methods by FT-IR. Potentially also microfluidic capillary electrophoresis (LabChip) or high resolution-MS-MALDI to support new product development
  • Optimize sample extraction procedures for various complex matrices such as dairy and bacterial fermentations
  • Use advanced data analytical tools to extract information from the data generated to visualize and communicate results
  • Coordinate with internal stakeholders and other departments. Communicate the results generated within different projects to ensure aligned interpretation of results and best experimental praxis

To succeed in this position, you must hold;

Preferably you hold a PhD or have similar experiences and have worked a few years with analytical chemistry or biochemistry. Natural flair and interest in data handling is a must. Experience with macromolecule chemistry such as proteins and carbohydrates together with hands-on instrument troubleshooting and method development is an advantage.

You are a superior team player, good at communicating with colleagues in the laboratory as well as with collaborators outside the team. You are fluent in both spoken and written English, you have a flexible mindset, and thrive with changing tasks and expertise areas.

Further, You Preferably Have

  • 2 to 5 years work experience
  • Practical experience using Python, R, SASJMP, Sample Manager and/or Benchling
  • Hands-on experience using FT-IR and multivariate analysis
  • Hand-on experience with one or more of following technologies; LabChip, HR-MS-MALDI, AF4-MALS, LC, GC, IC and MS systems
  • Experience in sample purification of small molecules or macromolecules from complex matrices

We do not expect you to have all of the above-mentioned skills, but we look forward to hearing from you if you have experience with some of these.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: November 1st, 2024. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Head of Explorative Biochemical Analytics Mette Kristensen at dkmetk@chr-hansen.com or +45 2240 7187.

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Title: Python Full Stack Developer
Description:
Python Full Stack Developer -JavaScript/Typescript

Experience: 3 - 20 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours

Work Hours: 5 hours overlap with the PST time zone

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years experience

Mandatory Skills-

Python: min 3 yrs,

JavaScript: min 3 yrs or Typescript: min 3 yrs,

Nest.js: min 1 yr, or React: min 2 yrs

Required Skills


3+ years of professional experience in Python
Strong SQL expertise with hands-on experience in database design, optimization, and management.
2+ years of experience with Nest JS or other backend frameworks.
Familiarity with AWS/GCP is a plus.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality code.


Nice to Have : Familiarity with front-end technologies (React or Angular) is a plus.

Familiarity with Python for scripting data analysis is a plus.


Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Job Description

We are seeking a full-stack engineer with a strong focus on backend development to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-performance software applications. Your expertise in Python and JavaScript (JS) will be crucial in building scalable and reliable backend systems.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience
Eager to learn and grow within the company, with a proactive approach to personal and professional development.
Reliable and consistent in delivering high-quality work.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv
