Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
With our product, Pleo is challenging outdated norms in the business spend industry by trusting employees to make purchases on the company's behalf -- no more expense reports or out of pocket spending. This puts trust in employees so that they can buy what they need when they need it. Future of work stuff, you know?

But let us introduce you to the domain this role will be part of:

The Spend Management helps our customers manage their spend with us in a way that's intuitive, efficient, and user-friendly. Humans interacting with our product should feel valued, delighted and impactful in whatever they are trying to do. This will be a fixed term contract of 12 months. However, we have a very good internal mobility program that means that the chances of finding a new position for another team after the 12 months pass are very high.

So What's Data & Analytics At Pleo Like?


At Pleo, our 40+ talented Data & Analytics professionals are on a mission to demystify data and drive company growth. 🔓 We're all about owning insights and fostering a culture of data literacy, shaping Pleo’s data strategy to empower stakeholders across the board
We're a diverse team of data & analytics engineers, analysts, and scientists, utilizing cutting-edge tools like Looker, BigQuery, dbt, and more
Our work spans the breadth of Pleo's operations, from platform intricacies to CRM data, financial records, and beyond

What Great Looks Like In This Role


Be part of the team that provides company-wide trusted insights on our products and features, focusing on predictive and prescriptive insights
Pave the way for Data Science at Pleo; establish methodologies for building machine learning (ML) models that help us deliver exceptional experiences to our customers and drive our revenue and user growth
You autonomously tackle complex problems with a solution-driven and pragmatic approach
You translate business problems into technical challenges, and take ownership in designing and executing the solutions
You effectively collaborate with product & engineering teams, and enable these stakeholders to develop data-inspired products and solutions
Demonstrate innovative thinking by exploring diverse data sources (internal and external) to improve the predictive power of your models
You are an ambassador for excellence within the Data & Analytics community, you lead by example, share your knowledge, and inspire others


Your Responsibilities


Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including product managers and business leaders, to understand their objectives and requirements. Lead the scoping, design, and development phases to create tailored, data-inspired solutions
Conduct quantitative research to inform product strategy and identify opportunities for improvement. Devise learning methods, including experiments, to test hypotheses and enhance our understanding of user behavior
Understand, identify, and leverage data sources across Pleo, encompassing both internal data and external data that can be utilized for building models
Monitor and optimize the performance of ML models, focusing on a long-term strategy to continuously improve user experiences
Translate complex data into actionable insights and effectively communicate technical work and findings to diverse audiences, ranging from product managers to leadership teams
Provide mentorship and guidance to other data & analytics team members, fostering a collaborative and learning-oriented environment within the data & analytics team
Stay abreast of advancements in ML and artificial intelligence, exploring opportunities to implement cutting-edge technologies in product development


Your Colleagues Say You:


Are self-sufficient, solution-driven, and love to see the impact of your work and team
Have excellent hands-on knowledge of SQL + Python/R and experience with more advanced analytics topics such as cohort and regression analysis
Expertise in applying data science within product teams to optimize features and user experiences. Demonstrate a track record of designing automated solutions with ML, particularly in the context of in-product decisions that align with business goals, ideally within the financial services industry
You have experience and comprehensive knowledge in machine learning (ML), covering a range of algorithms and techniques, including but not limited to the selection of appropriate models, tuning of hyperparameters, and rigorous evaluation of model performance. Are familiar with at least one cloud platform (GCP/AWS/Azure) and acquainted with ML Ops practices
Take proactive ownership, exhibit adaptability in problem-solving, and demonstrate authentic leadership with a commitment to radical candour


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

  • Have excellent hands-on knowledge of SQL + Python/R and experience with more advanced analytics topics such as cohort and regression analysis
  • Expertise in applying data science within product teams to optimize features and user experiences. Demonstrate a track record of designing automated solutions with ML, particularly in the context of in-product decisions that align with business goals, ideally within the financial services industry
  • You have experience and comprehensive knowledge in machine learning (ML), covering a range of algorithms and techniques, including but not limited to the selection of appropriate models, tuning of hyperparameters, and rigorous evaluation of model performance. Are familiar with at least one cloud platform (GCP/AWS/Azure) and acquainted with ML Ops practices
  • Take proactive ownership, exhibit adaptability in problem-solving, and demonstrate authentic leadership with a commitment to radical candour

Show me the benefits!

  • Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
  • Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
  • Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
  • We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
  • Flexibility/remote working options
  • Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
  • Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
  • We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
  • Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶

Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application

  • Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
  • We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
  • We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
  • When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Graduate Engineer Programme (Salaried )
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This job is with Thermo Fisher Scientific, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

Work Schedule

Standard (Mon-Fri)

Environmental Conditions

Some degree of PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) required (safety glasses, gowning, gloves, lab coat, ear plugs etc.)

Job Description

The role

We are looking for someone newly educated to join our 9-month EM (Electron Microscopy) Graduate Programme, to strengthen the Field Service Team for our Electron Microscopy Service organization within the EMEA region.

The EM Academy Engineer role is an entry-level position within the MSD Electron Microscopy Services organization and is ideal for a graduate interested in becoming a field service engineer. The work consists of a specific 9-month training and development program with multiple formal instructor-led training courses at our global training centres alongside extensive time of on-the-job learning in the assigned region, with more experienced engineer mentors.

Within the 9-month EM Academy Graduate Program we are expecting you to travel extensively within the region to gain invaluable technical skills in electron microscopy and experience in field service activities on a variety of electron microscopy systems. Upon completion of the graduate program EM Academy Engineers will advance into fully fledged Field Service Engineer positions, delivering outstanding customer service for our Electron Microscopy customers in your assigned service area.

About Division MSD

Our Materials and Structural Analysis business helps customers drive ground breaking research and discoveries by delivering innovative microscopy, spectroscopy and microanalysis solutions, such as best-in-class scanning and transmission electron microscopes, DualBeam™ FIB-SEMs, and spectrometers, combined with advanced software suites. We span across the business areas of spectroscopy, visualization software, semiconductor, life sciences, and material sciences, as well as global support functions, like commercial sales, service, operations, research and development, advanced technologies and marketing.

What will you do?


Attend one of our factories for an intensive introduction to our electron microscopes
Travel across the EMEA region to customer sites performing primarily planned activities including on-site installation, and preventive maintenance.
Document work done and adhere to standard operating procedures.
Provide continuous feedback to team members striving for continuous improvement and alignment with team objectives.
Complete the a9-month EM Academy Graduate Program and pass the end of program performance and skills review, to continue in role
Foster and develop positive working relationships with Thermofisher Scientific colleagues and customers assuring the highest level of customer experience.
Ensure full dedication and compliance company policies including all position specific Health and Safety laws and procedures.


What will you need?


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in mechatronics, mechanical / electrical / electronic, or equivalent engineering major.
Recent graduates (within the last 24 months) preferred.
Own or be able to obtain a valid passport and to travel up to 80%
A valid driver's license.
IT skills in Microsoft Windows and Office environments.
Good standard English language, verbal and written
Curiosity about technology with the motivation to develop own skills and knowledge within service engineering.
Attention to detail with good hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity to carry out precision mechanical work.
Some electronics or mechanical skills
Good team player!


What We Offer


Extensive training programme with competitive compensation
A collaborate and supportive team
Outstanding development and career prospects in an innovative and globally growing company.
A welcoming culture based on integrity, dedication and innovation.
Excellent development opportunities; attractive remuneration package and company benefits.
Annual bonus scheme


Thermofisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

About Thermo Fisher Scientific

Thermofisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with revenues of $42B and 125,000 employees in 50 countries. Our mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We help our customers accelerate life sciences research, take on sophisticated analytical challenges, improve patient diagnostics and increase laboratory efficiency. Through our world-class brands – Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific and Unity Lab Services – we offer an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and comprehensive support.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist in Group Risk Analytics (Maternity Cover)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you excited for data and data science? Do you take pride in your data assets and the data-driven decisions and insights they generate? Then come join our team of Data Scientists in Danske Bank!

Our team of 40+ that works with other teams across the bank to understand the bank’s data value chain. To support our unique functions and regulatory needs, our team stores, curates, and exposes big data. This enables us to master the end-to-end journey of our big data, as well as our modelling and analytic products. As a Data Scientist, you will be working on the top-priority project, which introduces a remediation approach related to the Bank’s debt collection and hence has a massive impact on Danske’s risk management.

You will be joining an international team located between Copenhagen and Vilnius. Therefore, solid English skills are a necessity for this role.

Don’t you meet every single requirement? At Danske Bank, we are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace and a healthy environment to develop in, so if you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Join a vibrant team at Danske Bank's. You will experience a culture that embraces Danske Bank's Culture Commitments: Be Open, Team Up, and Own It. Additionally, you will enjoy an attractive salary package, flexible work arrangements, and extensive professional development opportunities.

Please note that this is a fixed-term contract for maternity cover. Danske Bank supports a high degree of workplace flexibility (our team is currently using a hybrid working model, where we work at least 3 days a week in the office.).

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.

You will:


Work with data analysis and development of deterministic models for our debt collection remediation solutions
Integrate, explore, and aggregate the data. This includes data cleaning, data massage, error removal, and schema change
Attend and contribute to strategy alignment meetings across different teams
Dive deep into complex data issues using SQL and Python, performing investigative and risk analysis
Utilize git for version control to systematically develop, update, and maintain data models
Create detailed documentation and develop presentations to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively. Your ability to articulate complex data insights verbally, in writing, and visually should be advanced


About you:


Higher education within mathematics, computer science, engineering, statistics, physics, or similar
3+ years of relevant experience in data analytics or engineering field
Experience in handling large amounts of data and fluency in Python, R, SQL, PySpark, etc.
Have an analytical mindset and a fact-based approach
Hands-on with git and coding best practices
A curious individual with great problem-solving skills and the ability to keep result-oriented holistic view
Upper-Intermediate English skills


We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 to 4920 EUR monthly (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist, Senior.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me – Loreta Dailidonė via email lord@danskebank.lt, and I will answer your questions!

Loreta Dailidonė

lord@danskebank.lt

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist & Startup Founder (March 2025)
Description:
This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.




Who you are:

You are a highly skilled technical professional with a proven track record in developing innovative solutions. Your strong programming abilities and experience in building complex algorithms enable you to address critical challenges within the tech industry. You are a proactive individual with a passion for progress, driven to make a significant impact through cutting-edge technological advancements.




The Antler Founder Residency

Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.

12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Copenhagen.
Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!




Program Details

Start Date: March 3rd, 2025
Location: Onsite at our Copenhagen office
Compensation: While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
Visa Sponsorship: Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.




For our March 2025 cohort, we're looking for someone who:

Excel in Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI, with a knack for advancing technology.
Can unearth insights from intricate data, leading in ML methodologies.
Embrace the challenge of merging diverse data for revolutionary models.
Are adept at prototyping innovative solutions that pave the way for real-world applications.
Navigate product development with strategic foresight and precision.
Experienced in the start-up ecosystem
Optional: have an idea that solves a problem you’re passionate about, but you understand the need for co-pilots who share your vision and values




Application Process

Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:

Apply through our website.
Participate in an introductory interview.
Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
Receive a potential offer.




Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:

Wingbits: A community-driven flight data tracking platform
Two: A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
Evyon: A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
Glint Solar: Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
PerPlant: AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

Title: Python Developer - LLM
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 3+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Ideal Candidate Profile


3+ years of overall experience

Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Title: Senior manager, Data scientist in Corporate Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

This role is a strong opportunity to elevate digitalization in financial planning in the LEGO Group and to gain E2E knowledge on the LEGO Group's financial processes and grow a strong network across the organization!

As part of the Corporate reporting and planning team, you will play a key role in using data and drive innovation and continuous improvement in the financial planning processes and build on your already excellent finance data scientist career!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position


Core Responsibilities





Drive the aspiration on business analysis and push the data focus in defining the new financial planning processes
Leverage data driven forecasting in financial planning e.g. via driver-based planning, predictive planning and sensible machine learning to drive automation and reduced cycle time with less effort
Engage with partners across Finance to drive the implementation and support the change journey
Be one of the subject matter experts training and supporting colleagues building confidence in the data driven approach
Co-drive validation and recommendation on the model selection in a new forecast engine in collaboration with the technical developers
Prepare the reporting supporting transparency in the models and building a storyline on the development




Play your part in our team succeeding

Do you have what it takes?

We expect our preferred candidate to hold a Master's degree in Data science/Data engineering/ Economics / Finance or similar





5-8 years of experience with data science or data engineering, preferably with a focus on finance
Strong analytical skills and experience with predictive planning/ machine learning /Python/R or similar
Superb communication and collaboration skills
Location in Billund or Copenhagen office




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Analytical research scientist with data-driven mindset
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Denmark : Hoersholm

Country: Denmark

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new research scientist!

We are looking for an analytical scientist with high interest in data science and chemical analysis.

At Novonesis, you contribute every single day to a more sustainable future based on biological solutions. Novonesis develops and produces, among other things, bacterial cultures for yogurt and cheese, probiotics for food supplements, and new microbiological solutions to extend the shelf life of products. Explorative Biochemical Analytics is part of the R&D organization in Novonesis. Our analysis work is carried out in collaboration with various business areas such as Enzymes, Dairy, Cheese, Plantbased dairy alternatives, Bioprotection, Human, Animal and Plant Health.

Welcome to Explorative Biochemical Analytics

Explorative Biochemical Analytics develops biochemical methods of analysis and provides qualitative and quantitative data of small molecules, peptides, proteins and polysaccharides in biological matrices for use in projects and product development. We primarily use liquid chromatography as separation technique and mass spectrometry, UV, infrared spectroscopy, and light scattering for detection. We are active in many projects to accelerate mode of action understanding and to improve the chemical characterization of existing and future enzymatic and microbial products.

Explorative Biochemical Analytics is a multinational department where we emphasize good collaboration, room for all of us, and where we help each other. We value the good communication between researchers, laboratory technicians and students. We work closely together to solve our tasks.

In this role you will make a difference by;

As our new research scientist your daily work will be a combination of optimizing digital workflows, supporting our local data capture systems and hands-on-work in the analytical laboratory analyzing samples, troubleshooting, build new methods, data analysis, visualization of the results and project interaction.

Your role will be dual and you will work with data science by programming and optimization of our digital data workflows as well as working in the laboratory with analytical chemistry and biochemistry. We expect you to work in close collaboration with our sister department, Core Biochemical Analytics, especially on the data science part.

Your Tasks Will Include


Maintenance and optimization of LIMS and digital workflows
Sample analysis and method development with qualitative and quantitative methods by FT-IR. Potentially also microfluidic capillary electrophoresis (LabChip) or high resolution-MS-MALDI to support new product development
Optimize sample extraction procedures for various complex matrices such as dairy and bacterial fermentations
Use advanced data analytical tools to extract information from the data generated to visualize and communicate results
Coordinate with internal stakeholders and other departments. Communicate the results generated within different projects to ensure aligned interpretation of results and best experimental praxis


To succeed in this position, you must hold;

Preferably you hold a PhD or have similar experiences and have worked a few years with analytical chemistry or biochemistry. Natural flair and interest in data handling is a must. Experience with macromolecule chemistry such as proteins and carbohydrates together with hands-on instrument troubleshooting and method development is an advantage.

You are a superior team player, good at communicating with colleagues in the laboratory as well as with collaborators outside the team. You are fluent in both spoken and written English, you have a flexible mindset, and thrive with changing tasks and expertise areas.

Further, You Preferably Have


2 to 5 years work experience
Practical experience using Python, R, SASJMP, Sample Manager and/or Benchling
Hands-on experience using FT-IR and multivariate analysis
Hand-on experience with one or more of following technologies; LabChip, HR-MS-MALDI, AF4-MALS, LC, GC, IC and MS systems
Experience in sample purification of small molecules or macromolecules from complex matrices


We do not expect you to have all of the above-mentioned skills, but we look forward to hearing from you if you have experience with some of these.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

Application deadline: November 1st, 2024. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Head of Explorative Biochemical Analytics Mette Kristensen at dkmetk@chr-hansen.com or +45 2240 7187.

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Description:
LLM Python Developer

Experience: 3 - 6 Years

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Join Our Device Testing Panel and Earn EUR 10/hour!
Description:
Earn money simply by using your phone.

At OptikosPrime, we are developing mobile apps to enable easy eye testing using only smartphones. We occasionally need help testing features on specific phone models as part of our testing process.

We pay EUR 10 per hour every time we engage someone from our testing panel. Although a test typically takes less than 20 minutes, we pay for a full hour regardless.

If you want to join our panel, the application process is simple.

Just apply for the job, and we will send you a form where you can provide some basic information, including the exact phone model you have.

We will contact you as soon as we need to test your model.

Title: Scientific Data Engineer and Software Developer, Novonesis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Scientific Data Engineer and Software Developer

We are looking for two passionate data engineers/software developers to strengthen our team. The purpose of our team is to transform the way we carry out our scientific processes, through digitalization, to maximize the value we bring to our customers. The team specifically supports the applied R&D and technical service functions in Food & Beverages Biosolutions. The digital solutions we build are integral to maximizing the quality and efficiency of the research activities in FBB.

Welcome to Digitalization in Food & Beverages Biosolutions Applied Research

You will be part of a very diverse team, based in Denmark and France, with profiles including data scientists, digital specialists with an R&D background, and digital transformation partners. As part of our agile setup, you will be able to influence your tasks and your daily work through your input and thoughts on the goals for our digital transformation.

To join our high performing team, we are looking for few core characteristics:


First and foremost, you are a team player, you thrive working closely with your team members
You thrive in a matrix organization where collaboration and communication across the globe, and different seniority levels and roles is a natural part of your daily job


Across the two positions we are looking for the following technical skills to complement our team:


Software development experience, our software is primarily based on Python but we also use R for specific usecases
Frontend development, Novonesis primarily uses the React framework
Data engineering/data management, to better scale our solutions across, with a holistic view on data pipelines
Management and automation of lab hardware and robotics to integrate our labs with the digital space
UX Design and UX thinking, to better integrate our solutions with existing best practices


We Are Not Expecting a Single Candidate To Fill All These But Instead We Are Looking For a Pair Of Complementary Candidates That Best Strengthen Our Team. The Candidates Should Also Bring The Right Mindset To Succeed In The Position Which Could Include The Following Outlook And Experience


Interest in learning about topics outside your expertise
Proactive and looking for new ways to apply digital technologies to support science
Experience in translating real world processes in digital solutions
Willingness to work with proprietary software (e.g. Benchling) and develop on top of it
Experience with object-oriented programming and design
Experience with Linux based infrastructure and platforms
Experience with cloud platforms, in particular AWS


Location: This job is based at our site in Lyngby, Denmark with the possibility for working from home in average 1 day per week. You may need to work some days from our site in Hørsholm. While in general very little travel is expected (up to 10 days a year), the position is global meaning you may need to have meetings fitting other time zones (both Americas, and Asia).

Application deadline: November 3rd, 2024. Please note that applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis and therefore the ad may close before indicated deadline.

Contact details: Troels Thorsen Mørch, Senior Data Scientist, FBB Digital Applied Research, tthm@novonesis.com.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

HTML:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Scientific Data Engineer and Software Developer

We are looking for two passionate data engineers/software developers to strengthen our team. The purpose of our team is to transform the way we carry out our scientific processes, through digitalization, to maximize the value we bring to our customers. The team specifically supports the applied R&D and technical service functions in Food & Beverages Biosolutions. The digital solutions we build are integral to maximizing the quality and efficiency of the research activities in FBB.

Welcome to Digitalization in Food & Beverages Biosolutions Applied Research

You will be part of a very diverse team, based in Denmark and France, with profiles including data scientists, digital specialists with an R&D background, and digital transformation partners. As part of our agile setup, you will be able to influence your tasks and your daily work through your input and thoughts on the goals for our digital transformation.

To join our high performing team, we are looking for few core characteristics:

  • First and foremost, you are a team player, you thrive working closely with your team members
  • You thrive in a matrix organization where collaboration and communication across the globe, and different seniority levels and roles is a natural part of your daily job

Across the two positions we are looking for the following technical skills to complement our team:

  • Software development experience, our software is primarily based on Python but we also use R for specific usecases
  • Frontend development, Novonesis primarily uses the React framework
  • Data engineering/data management, to better scale our solutions across, with a holistic view on data pipelines
  • Management and automation of lab hardware and robotics to integrate our labs with the digital space
  • UX Design and UX thinking, to better integrate our solutions with existing best practices

We Are Not Expecting a Single Candidate To Fill All These But Instead We Are Looking For a Pair Of Complementary Candidates That Best Strengthen Our Team. The Candidates Should Also Bring The Right Mindset To Succeed In The Position Which Could Include The Following Outlook And Experience

  • Interest in learning about topics outside your expertise
  • Proactive and looking for new ways to apply digital technologies to support science
  • Experience in translating real world processes in digital solutions
  • Willingness to work with proprietary software (e.g. Benchling) and develop on top of it
  • Experience with object-oriented programming and design
  • Experience with Linux based infrastructure and platforms
  • Experience with cloud platforms, in particular AWS

Location: This job is based at our site in Lyngby, Denmark with the possibility for working from home in average 1 day per week. You may need to work some days from our site in Hørsholm. While in general very little travel is expected (up to 10 days a year), the position is global meaning you may need to have meetings fitting other time zones (both Americas, and Asia).

Application deadline: November 3rd, 2024. Please note that applications will be assessed on an ongoing basis and therefore the ad may close before indicated deadline.

Contact details: Troels Thorsen Mørch, Senior Data Scientist, FBB Digital Applied Research, tthm@novonesis.com.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Frontend Developer - AI Applications
Description:
Join our innovative team at BESTSELLER as we leverage cutting-edge AI and data-driven solutions to transform the retail and e-commerce experience.

We are looking for a skilled Frontend Developer who is passionate about creating intuitive, user-friendly interfaces and bringing interactive applications to life. This role places you at the heart of our APPRETIO platform - our commitment to revolutionizing merchandising through data-driven solutions.

YOUR TEAM

You will join the dynamic Data & Analytics department, a vibrant community of over 50 professionals passionate about driving the digital agenda at BESTSELLER. Within the APPRETIO product team of 12 professionals, you will focus on frontend development, ensuring seamless, high-quality user experiences across our applications.

YOUR NEW ROLE

As a Frontend Developer, you will play a key role in the development of interactive AI solutions that form the backbone of our data-driven decision-making. You will collaborate closely with backend developers, data scientists, and product managers to build and optimize applications that revolutionize business operations and strategy.

YOUR IMPACT

In your capacity as a frontend developer, you will:


Design, develop, and maintain frontend features for AI-driven applications.
Build intuitive user interfaces with technologies such as React, HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript and Python.
Focus on UI/UX best practices to maximize user satisfaction and engagement.
Collaborate with backend teams to ensure smooth integration of frontend and backend components.
Monitor, debug, and optimize applications for performance, scalability, and reliability.
Engage with product managers and designers to deliver seamless user experiences.


Your Benefits

This role offers a dynamic and challenging environment where quick, impactful decisions are the norm. You will:


Become a part of a diverse and expert team in a supportive, inclusive, and dynamic work environment that values collaboration and innovation.
Advance your career with extensive professional growth opportunities, including leadership development, specialized training programs, and exposure to international projects.
Access ongoing educational programs and certifications to advance your career.


YOUR PROFILE

You are an energetic, proactive team player passionate about frontend development and creating engaging user interfaces. You can recognize yourself in most of the following statements:


A degree in computer science, software en gineering, or a related field.
Strong experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Tailwind, TypeScript, and React.
Familiarity with Python a nd containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and building/maintaining production-grade web applications.
A keen interest in UI/UX and optimizing user experiences.
Fluency in English, both spoken and written.


The following qualifications would also be an advantage:


Experience with cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure).
Familiarity with database management systems (SQL, NoSQL).
Interest in AI applications and their integration into user-facing features.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and their practical applications in a business context.
Knowledge about translating business processes into tangible application elements.
Knowledge about data visualization tools such as Plotly Dash or Streamlit.


WORK LOCATION

Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

For inquiries about the position, don’t hesitate to contact Emil Hartvig Pedersen at +45 29628203. Please send your application and CV as soon as possible and no later than October 21st, 2024. We review candidates on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the job ad when we have found the right candidate.

About Bestseller

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 20,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.

Title: Senior Software Engineer, Graphics and ML
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Make a difference in the performance of games and other applications on billions of Arm-based devices! Join our innovative graphics research team and shape the future of mobile graphics.

This role is within the growing Strategy and Ecosystems team responsible for enabling the best possible developer experience of Graphics and Gaming applications on Arm.

We are looking for an inquisitive software engineer, passionate about Computer Graphics, willing to explore the full software stack and the underlying hardware and processor architecture.

Responsibilities

The main responsibility of the team is to perform extensive research into the latest mobile graphics techniques, such as GPU Driven rendering and global illumination, identifying performance bottlenecks and new and interesting graphics techniques.. The team also analyses important workloads from partners and benchmark vendors, and implements optimizations for improved performance and power.

Required Skills And Experience


Strong C/C++ programming skills
Experience in using a modern graphics API
Graphics rendering techniques
Good communication skills
University degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience


“Nice To Have” Skills And Experience


Deep understanding of Unreal or Unity rendering pipeline
Machine learning / Neural Graphics
Experience with debugging and profiling
Arm Mali or other GPU architectures
Mobile software and developer landscape
Agile Scrum process
Android or Linux internals


In Return

You will be provided with training and support to excel in this role, as a part of a friendly team who is passionate about graphics. Moreover, Arm offices offer an amazing place to collaborate and meet your colleagues also through social and volunteering activities.

Accommodations at Arm

At Arm, we want our people to Do Great Things. If you need support or an accommodation to Be Your Brilliant Self during the recruitment process, please email accommodations@arm.com . To note, by sending us the requested information, you consent to its use by Arm to arrange for appropriate accommodations. All accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality, and information concerning these requests will only be disclosed as necessary to provide the accommodation. Although this is not an exhaustive list, examples of support include breaks between interviews, having documents read aloud or office accessibility. Please email us about anything we can do to accommodate you during the recruitment process.

Hybrid Working at Arm

Arm’s approach to hybrid working is designed to create a working environment that supports both high performance and personal wellbeing. We believe in bringing people together face to face to enable us to work at pace, whilst recognizing the value of flexibility. Within that framework, we empower groups/teams to determine their own hybrid working patterns, depending on the work and the team’s needs. Details of what this means for each role will be shared upon application. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution. Please talk to us to find out more about what this could look like for you.

Equal Opportunities at Arm

Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Title: Platform Engineer
Place: Vejle Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Platform Engineer - Vejle or Copenhagen - .NET - AWS - Microservices - DevOps - Cloud Architecture




We are looking for a Software Developer who has the experience or ambition to become a technical lead for one of our clients in Vejle. The company is a European leader in the automotive industry and provides a b2b and a b2c platform for car sales, rental, leasing, and ride-sharing.




You will join one of the biggest and most skilled software development teams in Vejle. You will have the chance to work alongside software developers, data experts, architects, and cloud professionals working on a range of different software products.




Let's dive into your key responsibilities, you will

Oversee the reliability and operational performance of products within your domain, driving continuous improvement and innovation.
Collaborate with various teams to accelerate problem resolution and promote a culture of rapid and effective response.
Develop and enhance tools and frameworks that simplify software development processes and increase team productivity.
Provide mentorship and support to peers, fostering a supportive and engaging team environment.




The need-to-have skills

Platform Engineering and Developer Experience (DevEx) Enablement: Demonstrated ability in enhancing the Developer Experience by deploying effective tooling and platform products that empower development teams, aligned with best practices in platform engineering.
Guidance in Advanced Architectural Patterns: Proven capability in supporting development teams with platform products, services, cloud-native and serverless solutions.
Infrastructure as Code: Extensive experience in Infrastructure as Code and Continuous Delivery with mandatory proficiency in Terraform and a strong preference for knowledge of AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
AWS Cloud Services Proficiency: In-depth expertise in AWS cloud services, demonstrating robust skills in platform engineering and the strategic application of design patterns.
Core IaaS Components Knowledge: Solid understanding of fundamental IaaS components, including computing, storage, and networking, ensuring a robust infrastructure setup.
CI/CD Implementation Skills: Proficient in deploying CI/CD solutions, ideally with GitHub Actions.




You will thrive in this role if you:

Have a curious mindset and always want to get hands-on experience with the newest technologies
Are a team player, who loves to share their knowledge with colleagues and like-minded enthusiast
Have a strong sense of ownership for the solutions you develop




To apply, please submit your resume detailing your relevant experience for this role to L.Mohammed-Brown@frankgroup.com.

Title: Fullstack Developer 15 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Fullstack Developer to join our team for a 15-month contract. In this role, you will be responsible for developing robust web applications, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality features that meet client specifications. Your expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies will be essential in driving project success.


You will design and implement user-friendly interfaces while ensuring seamless interactions with backend services
You will utilize your experience with various programming languages and frameworks to deliver scalable and maintainable code
You will actively participate in code reviews, contributing to team knowledge sharing and improvement of coding standards
You will ensure that applications are tested thoroughly and optimized for performance
You will communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather requirements and provide updates on project progress
Experience with modern version control systems and development practices

Expertise in designing and implementing user-friendly interfaces and backend services
Proficient in various programming languages and frameworks for scalable code
Experience with code reviews and a commitment to improving coding standards
Thorough testing and optimization of applications for performance
Effective communication skills for stakeholder interaction and project updates
Familiarity with modern version control systems and development practices

Title: Full-stack developer for SaaS platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Gismap is a pioneering NatureTech startup focused on transforming biodiversity management in the real estate and construction sectors. We’re building an innovative platform that helps businesses track, measure, and enhance biodiversity, leveraging cutting-edge AI and geospatial technologies. We believe technology is key to solving the biodiversity crisis, and we’re looking for a talented Full-Stack Developer to join us on this mission.

What You'll Do

As a full-stack developer at Gismap, you’ll play a key role in building and scaling our data-driven platform, working closely with our tech team to ensure smooth integrations and high-quality features. You’ll be responsible for both the front-end and back-end aspects of our platform, helping to deliver a seamless user experience.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with our team to develop new features for the Gismap platform
Working on both the client-side (React.js) and server-side (Django, PostgreSQL with PostGIS)
Building APIs and integrating with third-party applications and data sources
Optimizing the platform for performance and scalability
Writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code
Troubleshooting and debugging to improve platform functionality
Contributing your expertise, sharing your perspective, and helping shape the development roadmap as a key member of the team
Meeting up regularly at our office in Nørrebro, Copenhagen for collaborative teamwork in a social and easy-going atmosphere


What we’re looking for

You are a skilled Full-Stack Developer who is passionate about working on solutions that address environmental challenges. You thrive in a team-oriented environment, enjoy working in a social atmosphere, and are comfortable collaborating with others to make an impact.


Proven experience in front-end development: Strong knowledge of React.js or similar frameworks
Back-end development skills: Expertise in Django, Python, and PostgreSQL with PostGIS
Experience working with geospatial data is a plus (e.g., GeoPandas, Turf.js)
Experience working with APIs and integrating external systems
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt quickly to new challenges
A team player who thrives in a social, easy-going work environment
Good understanding of version control (Git)
Enthusiasm for working in a fast-paced, collaborative startup environment
Experience with GCP (Google Cloud Platform) and Docker are nice to have but not required
Must be able to work from our office in Nørrebro on a regular basis
Interest in NatureTech or sustainability sectors is a big plus


What we offer


The opportunity to work on a groundbreaking product that contributes to solving the biodiversity crisis
A passionate and talented team that values innovation, collaboration, and a fun work atmosphere
Flexible working hours with the option to occasionally work from home
Competitive salary with growth potential as the company scales
The chance to grow your skills and career in a purpose-driven startup


Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, but we expect to hire as soon as possible, and no later than mid-November.

For more information or questions please contact us at lsu@gismap.dk or phone number +4561600597

Title: Frontend Developer - Remote
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Frontend Developer Internship

Frontend Developer Internship (Angular + NestJS) (Remote – Unpaid, Minimum 3 Months)

Are you passionate about web development and eager to enhance your skills in a real-world environment? We are looking for a motivated Frontend Developer Intern to join our team for a minimum of 3 months. This is a remote internship, but candidates located in Denmark will be given preference.

About The Role

As a Frontend Developer Intern, you will work closely with our development team to build and enhance user interfaces for our AI-powered platform. You will gain hands-on experience with modern web technologies like Angular and NestJS and have the opportunity to contribute to real projects.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with designers and backend developers to create responsive and dynamic web applications using Angular and NestJS.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using HTML, CSS, and TypeScript.
Assist in developing and improving user interface components.
Debug and troubleshoot frontend issues.
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends in frontend development.


What We’re Looking For


Basic understanding of Angular, NestJS, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript.
Familiarity with version control using Git.
Passion for creating user-friendly and visually appealing web interfaces.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and collaborate in a remote team environment.
Willingness to learn and take on new challenges.


Nice To Have


Experience with MySQL and understanding of RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.
Interest in AI technologies.
Based in Denmark (a plus but not mandatory).


What We Offer


Hands-on experience with real-world projects.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work remotely with an international team.
Mentorship and guidance to help you grow as a developer.
Potential for full-time employment after the internship based on performance.


Duration

Minimum 3 months (unpaid internship).

Flexible start date.

We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Scientist, Trust & Safety
Description:
Bumble is looking for a Data Scientist to join our team and play a key role in fulfilling our mission to create a world where all relationships are healthy and equitable. Concretely, this means exploring our large datasets, developing statistical models and designing data-driven strategies for products that provide a safe and engaging experience for our users, and improve the way Bumble operates.

With billions of collected data points and millions of images and messages exchanged on our platform every day, there is a wealth of opportunity to make a real difference in this role and help people to find love all over the world! The ideal candidate combines strong business acumen, extensive experience in data science and advanced analytics along with a background in trust & safety.

Trust & Safety

We are part of the Trust & Safety Engineering group, a cross-functional team of 40+  engineers, scientists and machine learning professionals that help grow kind, healthy & equitable connections by designing and operationalizing the safest and most trusted connections platform in the industry.  We partner with the wider business to create and share tooling, knowledge, and best practices around Trust and Safety technology while undertaking special product and development initiatives designed to improve the actual safety and felt experience of safety of members across our products. We’re known by the wider industry as experts in our field, and give back to the community through thought leadership, information sharing, and open-sourcing.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Work in a cross-functional team alongside data scientists and machine learning engineers
Analyse large sets of data and work closely with Safety Product Management to educate roadmaps and define key metrics, aligning them with Bumble Inc's goals
Identify areas of maximum value and contribute to setting up frameworks for evaluating algorithmic improvements. 
Initiate and conduct large-scale experiments to test hypotheses and drive product development
Partner effectively with business functions and engineering teams to translate problems into scalable AI solutions, leveraging the richness of our extensive and intricate datasets
Foster a culture of insightful storytelling across our Group and the business, emphasising collaboration and connection within the team. Your style is characterised by empathy, open communication, and a commitment to promoting diversity and inclusion





WE’D LOVE TO MEET SOMEONE WITH
Strong statistical modelling background - hypotheses testing, inference, regressions, random variables
Comfortable presenting back to technical and non-technical stakeholders through effective data visualisation and building of reporting frameworks
Comfortable with Python data science libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, statsmodels
Strong SQL experience including analytic functions, performance tuning, data wrangling
Ability to work collaboratively and proactively in a fast-paced environment alongside scientists, engineers and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to combine business intuition with the application of advanced solutions
A passion for keeping up with the latest ongoings in Data Science and Machine Learning communities
A curious mind, self-starter and endlessly keen to learn and develop themselves professionally





AN ADDED BONUS IF YOU HAVE
A proven background in trust & safety or experience of working in a similar role
An understanding of multi-sided markets and/or dating problem space
Experience in using advanced statistical methods to solve problems. This can either be through academic projects and publications, or experience analysing and solving problems within industry
Understanding of Machine Learning development lifecycle
A basic knowledge of software development life cycle processes and tools - ETL pipelines, CI/CD, MLOps, agile methodologies, version control (git), testing frameworks 





Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Within the Digital Finance team, the Data Scientist will be responsible for developing machine learning solutions for high-profile data science initiatives. The Data Scientist will notably focus on designing and training predictive analytics models, crafting signals from unstructured data and creating high-value-added solutions converting quantitative predictions into actionable insights for the business.

A successful candidate will demonstrate an excellent knowledge of the various steps of a machine learning project, including modeling and MLOps. The candidate should also be innovation-minded, result-oriented, autonomous, and able to deliver finished products, sometimes under short deadlines.

The data science team works  closely with technology teams, rating and research teams, and other departments. The candidate should therefore be able to collaborate across multiple divisions and communicate clearly and understandably to business representatives unfamiliar with data science.

The Data Scientist will also strive to meet Moody’s values: openness, diversity, inclusivity, respect, and a willingness to learn.

 

The duties of the Data Scientist include:

Select and train machine learning models for predictive analytics, sometimes with relatively small and unbalanced datasets.
Build solutions predicting activities and extracting signals from multiple data sources.
Design explainability tools understandable by non-data scientists.
Collaborate with tech teams to create data ingestion pipelines connected to sources spread across different parts of the organization and delivered in varying formats.
Communicate results to business stakeholders and decision-makers.
Collaborate with subject matter experts from ratings and research teams to incorporate fundamental expertise into machine learning models.
Stay current with the latest research and technology developments.




Qualifications

Master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
Experience  in machine learning, with a strong knowledge of algorithms and principles.
Proven track record of successfully modeling, building, and putting in production machine learning applications.
Deep understanding of the tools explaining machine learning predictions.
Expertise in Python and SQL.
Knowledge of Git and collaboration principles.
Proven experience in natural language processing.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.
Previous experience in corporate finance or debt markets is preferred.




Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (Graduate) x 3

Location: London (Hybrid)

Salary: £30,000 - £45,000




Join a pioneering London-based Financial Services company that is transforming the investment landscape with innovative solutions. With a £50M funding secured in the last 6 months, this Series-B funded company is poised for exponential growth and is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join their dynamic team.




Role Overview:

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in analysing and interpreting complex data to help shape the future of financial technology. Your insights will drive key business decisions and contribute to the development of cutting-edge investment products.




This position offers the flexibility of a hybrid working model, combining remote work with time in the London office, within an exciting and fast-paced environment.




Qualifications: - Bachelor's or Master's degree from a Russell Group university, preferably in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.




- Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.




Benefits:

- Performance-based bonus.

- Private health and dental insurance.

- Stock options.

- Opportunity to work in a hybrid position.

- Be part of a fast-growing company with significant funding and growth potential.




How to Apply:




If you are a motivated Junior Data Scientist looking to make a significant impact in the Financial Services industry, we would love to hear from you. Please click apply for immediate consideration.
